original: @226b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @226b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa bhi she ka pra ka ra na /
analyzed: aa bhi she ka pra ka ra na /
translated: Abhisekaprakarana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbang gi rab tu byed pa /
analyzed: dbang gi rab tu byed pa /
translated: The Rite of Initiation

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga ni /
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga ni /
translated: The rite of preliminary service

original: lha yi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lha yi 'khor lo bsgom par bya //
translated: is to meditate on the circle of deities.

original: skyo na de yi gsang sngags bzla //
analyzed: skyo na de yi gsang sngags bzla //
translated: When weary, recite their secret mantra.

original: 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i 'bum bzlas te //🔽yang na rang gi lha yi 'bum //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i 'bum bzlas te // yang na rang gi lha yi 'bum //
translated: Recite the hundred thousand of the principal deity of the circle,🔽or the hundred thousand of one's own deity,

original: dkyil 'khor pa yi khri yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa yi khri yin no //
translated: or the ten thousand of the circle deities.

original: bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of service.

original: de nas dgun zla ra ba dang / dpyid zla 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dbyar zla gsum pa dang / ston zla ra ba'i tshes gcig dang / gsum dang / lnga dang / bdun dang / bcu dang / bcu gsum dang / bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de nas dgun zla ra ba dang / dpyid zla 'bring po dang / tha chungs dang / dbyar zla gsum pa dang / ston zla ra ba'i tshes gcig dang / gsum dang / lnga dang / bdun dang / bcu dang / bcu gsum dang / bco lnga'o //
translated: Then, on the first, third, fifth, seventh, tenth, thirteenth, or fifteenth day of the first winter month, the middle spring month, the last month of spring, the first of the three summer months, or the first autumn month,

original: gza' zla ba dang / lhag pa dang / phur bu dang / pa ba sangs so //
analyzed: gza' zla ba dang / lhag pa dang / phur bu dang / pa ba sangs so //
translated: under the auspices of the planets Monday, Tuesday, Mercury, or Venus,

original: rgyu skar snar ma dang / mgo dang / lag dang / rgyal dang / dbo dang / me bzhi dang / lha mtshams dang / snron dang / snrubs dang / gro bzhin dang / chu stod dang / chu smad dang / khrums stod dang / khrums smad do //
analyzed: rgyu skar snar ma dang / mgo dang / lag dang / rgyal dang / dbo dang / me bzhi dang / lha mtshams dang / snron dang / snrubs dang / gro bzhin dang / chu stod dang / chu smad dang / khrums stod dang / khrums smad do //
translated: The lunar mansions are Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasū, Puṣyā, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāphālgunī, Uttarāphālgunī, Hasta, Citrā, Svātī, Viśākhā, Anurādhā, Jyeṣṭhā, Mūlā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Abhijit, Śravaṇa, Dhaniṣṭhā, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvābhādrapadā, Uttarābhādrapadā, and Revatī.

original: sbyor ba byed ba bzang bo brtags nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don du slob mas lan gsum du gsol pa gdab po //
analyzed: sbyor ba byed ba bzang bo brtags nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don du slob mas lan gsum du gsol pa gdab po //
translated: Having examined the good conjunctions, the disciple should supplicate three times for the sake of drawing the maṇḍala.

original: de'i tshe slob ma'i lte bar nyi ma la h'um gi 'od zer gyi snying @227a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe slob ma'i lte bar nyi ma la h'um gi 'od zer gyi snying @227a * //
translated: At that time, at the disciple’s navel, the light rays of hūṃ on the sun enter the heart.

original: ga'i kam nag po las byung ba'i sdig pa sha za lta bu rlig pa 'phyang ba skra gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: ga'i kam nag po las byung ba'i sdig pa sha za lta bu rlig pa 'phyang ba skra gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: The sin that arises from the black kaṃ in the heart is like a flesh-eating demon, with a hanging penis, and hair standing upward.

original: sna rtse nas bton la h'um de yang snying gar 'ongs te /
analyzed: sna rtse nas bton la h'um de yang snying gar 'ongs te /
translated: Having expelled it from the tip of the nose, that hūṃ also enters the heart.

original: h'um mdzad du gyur nas phyir bton la /🔽aom sumbha ni su mbha h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: h'um mdzad du gyur nas phyir bton la / aom sumbha ni su mbha h'um h'um phat /
translated: Having become Caṇḍa, expel it.🔽oṃ sumbha niḥ sumbha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom grihna pa ya grihna pa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom grihna pa ya grihna pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, take hold, take hold, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a na ya ho:bha ga b'a na bidy'a r'a dza ya aa mu ka sya p'a pam n'a sa ya n'a sa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho:bha ga b'a na bidy'a r'a dza ya aa mu ka sya p'a pam n'a sa ya n'a sa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, I pay homage to the lord of the vidyā king, the remover of the misfortune of so-and-so, destroy, destroy, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: phyag gi rdo rjes sdig pa bton nas brlag par bsam mo //
analyzed: phyag gi rdo rjes sdig pa bton nas brlag par bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that Vajrapāṇi removes and destroys the misfortune.

original: slob ma'i sems kyi bgegs ni /
analyzed: slob ma'i sems kyi bgegs ni /
translated: The obstacle of the mind of the disciple is

original: aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya aa mu ka sya sarba bighn'am bandha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya aa mu ka sya sarba bighn'am bandha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, vajra kill, kill, the obstacles of so-and-so, bind, hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces brjod cing phur bu gdab bo //
analyzed: ces brjod cing phur bu gdab bo //
translated: Recite this and drive in the dagger.

original: phur bu'i 'od zer gyis sdig pa rnams bsreg go //
analyzed: phur bu'i 'od zer gyis sdig pa rnams bsreg go //
translated: The light rays of the dagger burn the misfortune.

original: de nas slob ma sam las kun du bzang por bsams la snying gar zla ba la sna tshogs rdo rje bsam /
analyzed: de nas slob ma sam las kun du bzang por bsams la snying gar zla ba la sna tshogs rdo rje bsam /
translated: Then, imagine that the disciple is Samantabhadra and visualize a vajra cross on a moon at the heart.

original: mgo la zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus su lha mo m'a ma k'i bzhugs par bsams la /
analyzed: mgo la zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsams pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba'i dbus su lha mo m'a ma k'i bzhugs par bsams la /
translated: On the head, imagine a five-pronged vajra from hūṃ on a moon, and in the center of the hub of the vajra, imagine goddess Māmakī.

original: de'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i steng gi rdo rje'i lte ba'i nang gi sngags kyi phreng ba las byung ba'i rdo rje phra mos lus khyab par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka'i zla ba'i steng gi rdo rje'i lte ba'i nang gi sngags kyi phreng ba las byung ba'i rdo rje phra mos lus khyab par bya ste /
translated: One should protect with the mantra garland that has come from the mantra garland in the center of the vajra on the moon at his heart, with the vajra-like subtle vajras that pervade the body.

original: aom a'a:sham ka re sh'antim ka re ghu ta ghu ta ghu ti ni /
analyzed: aom a'a:sham ka re sh'antim ka re ghu ta ghu ta ghu ti ni /
translated: Om aḥ śamkare śāntikare ghuṭa ghuṭa ghuṭini

original: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya /
analyzed: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya /
translated: ghātaya ghātaya

original: ghu ti ni ghu ti ni aa mu ka raksha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ghu ti ni ghu ti ni aa mu ka raksha sv'a h'a /
translated: ghūṭini ghūṭini amuka rakṣa svāhā.

original: zhes bsrung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bsrung ngo //
translated: One should protect with this.

original: 'khyil pa'i sngags sbyin no //
analyzed: 'khyil pa'i sngags sbyin no //
translated: One should give the mantra of the coiled one.

original: slob ma bzung ba'i cho ga'o//
analyzed: slob ma bzung ba'i cho ga'o//
translated: The ritual for taking the disciple.

original: de nas dkar po'i tshes gcig dang / brgyad dang / bcu dang / bcu gsum dang / bcu bzhi dang nya nas nya'i bar du snga dro nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor gyi las bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkar po'i tshes gcig dang / brgyad dang / bcu dang / bcu gsum dang / bcu bzhi dang nya nas nya'i bar du snga dro nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor gyi las bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning in the morning from the first day of the bright fortnight, the eighth, the tenth, the thirteenth, the fourteenth, and the full moon, one should perform the maṇḍala rite.

original: grong dang skyed mos tshal dang lha khang dang khyim rnams kyi phyogs mtshams bdun dang mchod rten la nye ba dang klu gnas ba'i chu la nya ba dang shing gcig la nye ba dor la dbang ldan du khung bu mtho gang brus la slar bkang ste lhag na
analyzed: grong dang skyed mos tshal dang lha khang dang khyim rnams kyi phyogs mtshams bdun dang mchod rten la nye ba dang klu gnas ba'i chu la nya ba dang shing gcig la nye ba dor la dbang ldan du khung bu mtho gang brus la slar bkang ste lhag na
translated: In the northeast, dig a hole one cubit deep, fill it back up, and if it overflows,🔽it is good.

original: bzang / yang chus bkang la gom pa brgyar phyin nas chu dma' bar ma song na bzang /
analyzed: bzang / yang chus bkang la gom pa brgyar phyin nas chu dma' bar ma song na bzang /
translated: Also, fill it with water, go one hundred steps, and if the water does not go down, it is good.

original: chu sgra dang bcas na klu'i gnod pa 'ong /
analyzed: chu sgra dang bcas na klu'i gnod pa 'ong /
translated: If there is a sound of water, there will be harm from nagas.

original: sa brtag pa'o //
analyzed: sa brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the examination of the earth.

original: mandala byas la dkyil 'khor pa dang zhing skyong la sogs pa la mchod gtor bya ste /
analyzed: mandala byas la dkyil 'khor pa dang zhing skyong la sogs pa la mchod gtor bya ste /
translated: Having made a mandala, offer a bali to the mandala deities, field protectors, and so forth.

original: gang dag 'der gnas lha dang klu //
analyzed: gang dag 'der gnas lha dang klu //
translated: Whatever gods and nagas

original: gnod sbyin srin po'am gzhan yang rung //
analyzed: gnod sbyin srin po'am gzhan yang rung //
translated: yakshas, rakshasas, or others🔽dwell here,

original: sa 'di bdag gis bslang bgyid na //
analyzed: sa 'di bdag gis bslang bgyid na //
translated: please grant this earth

original: dkyil 'khor don du stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor don du stsal du gsol //
translated: for the sake of the mandala.

original: zhes lan gsum gsol ba gdab po //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum gsol ba gdab po //
translated: Repeat this supplication three times.

original: @227b sa bslang ba'o //
analyzed: @227b sa bslang ba'o //
translated: This is the taking of the earth.

original: rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am ma bkag par go na nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro nam mkha'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis gnang ba nos la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'am bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs par byin pa'am ma bkag par go na nyi ma gzhan gyi snga dro nam mkha'i rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis gnang ba nos la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'am bsgom pa'am /
translated: If one understands that the earth is given or not obstructed in a dream and so forth, then in the morning of another day, one mentally receives permission from Ākāśa-vajra-āḍhaka and so forth, and one should drive away obstructors with the protection wheel and the kīla of obstructors, or by meditation, or by fierce burnt offerings.

original: drag po'i sbyin sreg gis bgegs bskrad la slob ma la bsrung ba'i don du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas la /
analyzed: drag po'i sbyin sreg gis bgegs bskrad la slob ma la bsrung ba'i don du zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas la /
translated: For the sake of protecting the disciples, one should perform a peaceful burnt offering.

original: sa de la las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang chu dang thal bas bsang po //
analyzed: sa de la las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i yungs kar dang chu dang thal bas bsang po //
translated: One should sprinkle that ground with mustard seeds, water, and ash, while reciting the all-activity mantra.

original: de nas sa'i lha mo spyan drang zhing mchod la /
analyzed: de nas sa'i lha mo spyan drang zhing mchod la /
translated: Then one should invite the earth goddess, make offerings,

original: lan gsum gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: lan gsum gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: and supplicate three times.

original: gyis zhes zer ba dang yid kyis nam mkhar bteg la /
analyzed: gyis zhes zer ba dang yid kyis nam mkhar bteg la /
translated: When she says, “Do it!” one should mentally lift her up into the sky,

original: sa de la klu nyal bas de'i pang pa'i char brko'o //
analyzed: sa de la klu nyal bas de'i pang pa'i char brko'o //
translated: and dig down to the level of her lap, since the nāgas lie on the ground.

original: de la gza' nyi ma rgyu pa'i ston zla tha chungs la sogs pa'i zla ba gsum pa la rim pa bzhin shar lho nub byang du mgo bo blta zhing lho la sogs par phyogs te nyal lo //
analyzed: de la gza' nyi ma rgyu pa'i ston zla tha chungs la sogs pa'i zla ba gsum pa la rim pa bzhin shar lho nub byang du mgo bo blta zhing lho la sogs par phyogs te nyal lo //
translated: In the three months beginning with the month of Karttika, when the sun moves to the south, he should sleep in the east, south, west, and north, respectively, with his head toward the east, etc., and facing the south, etc.

original: sa brko ba'o //
analyzed: sa brko ba'o //
translated: He should dig the ground.

original: de nas skyon dang zug rdu bsal bar mi nus pa la lag pa reg cing 'khyil pa bzlas pas dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas skyon dang zug rdu bsal bar mi nus pa la lag pa reg cing 'khyil pa bzlas pas dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if he is unable to remove the faults and pains, he should touch the ground with his hand and recite the Kilik kili mantra.

original: dri'i chu dang bsres la dong dgang ngo //
analyzed: dri'i chu dang bsres la dong dgang ngo //
translated: He should fill the pit with scented water.

original: ma khengs na gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: ma khengs na gzhan yang ngo //
translated: If it does not fill, he should add more.

original: sa'i dbus su rin po che lnga dang sman lnga dang 'bru lnga gzhug go //
analyzed: sa'i dbus su rin po che lnga dang sman lnga dang 'bru lnga gzhug go //
translated: In the middle of the ground, he should place the five precious substances, the five medicines, and the five grains.

original: de nas h'um dang las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus gtor zhing brdungs la khru phyed mtho zhing dbus cung zad mtho la byang shar cung zad dma' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas h'um dang las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i chus gtor zhing brdungs la khru phyed mtho zhing dbus cung zad mtho la byang shar cung zad dma' bar bya'o //
translated: Then, sprinkling and striking with water incanted with the Hûṁkāra and the all-activity mantra, he should make the ground one cubit high, slightly higher in the middle, and slightly lower in the northeast.

original: khang thog dang rdo stengs la sogs pa ma brkos kyang dag pa yin no //
analyzed: khang thog dang rdo stengs la sogs pa ma brkos kyang dag pa yin no //
translated: If the ground is not dug, such as on a roof or a stone surface, it is pure.

original: yungs kar dad chu dang thal ba la 'khyil pa bzlas pas bsang ngo //
analyzed: yungs kar dad chu dang thal ba la 'khyil pa bzlas pas bsang ngo //
translated: Purify with mustard seed, water, and ashes, repeating the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.🔽Anoint with the five products of a cow and scented water, repeating that mantra.

original: ba'i rnam lnga dang dri'i chu la de bzlas pas g-yas skor du byugs la aom bhu kham gis stong par bya //
analyzed: ba'i rnam lnga dang dri'i chu la de bzlas pas g-yas skor du byugs la aom bhu kham gis stong par bya //
translated: With oṃ bhruṃ khaṃ, make it empty.

original: aom lam h'um gis rdo rjer bsgoms te /
analyzed: aom lam h'um gis rdo rjer bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on it as a vajra with oṃ laṃ hūṃ.

original: aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba bandha h'um zhes lag pas reg cing byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: aom me di n'i badzr'i bha ba bandha h'um zhes lag pas reg cing byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: Bless it by touching it with your hand and saying oṃ medinī vajra bhava bhandha hūṃ.

original: de nas nam mkha' na gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo mchod de bstims la h'um lam h'um brjod cing pad kor gyi phyag rgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' na gnas pa'i sa'i lha mo mchod de bstims la h'um lam h'um brjod cing pad kor gyi phyag rgya bya'o //
translated: Then, worship the goddess of the earth who is in space, dissolve her, and say hūṃ laṃ hūṃ, making the gesture of a crossed vajra.

original: yi ge brgya pa brjod do //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa brjod do //
translated: Recite the hundred-syllable mantra.🔽Imagine that the earth is of one taste with emptiness, and meditate on it as empty.

original: sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par brtan par mos la stong par bsgom pa ni bla na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par brtan par mos la stong par bsgom pa ni bla na med pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the unexcelled purification.

original: sa sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: sa sbyong ba'o //
translated: This is the purification of the site.

original: de nas rdo rje dang dril bu bzung nas sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dang dril bu bzung nas sa'i dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: Then, holding a vajra and a bell, sit in the center of the ground.

original: srung ba'i 'khor los bgegs bsal nas /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor los bgegs bsal nas /
translated: Having cleared away obstructors with the protection wheel,

original: lce rdo rjer bsams la /
analyzed: lce rdo rjer bsams la /
translated: imagine your tongue as a vajra.

original: ma lus phyogs @228a * //🔽rnams kun bzhugs pa'i //
analyzed: ma lus phyogs @228a * // rnams kun bzhugs pa'i //
translated: All the buddhas dwelling

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la dgongs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bdag la dgongs //
translated: in all the directions,🔽think of me!

original: bdag ming rdo rje che ge mos //
analyzed: bdag ming rdo rje che ge mos //
translated: I, Vajra so-and-so,

original: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri bar bgyid //
translated: will draw the maṇḍala here.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs kun byon nas //
translated: Having invited all the buddhas and so forth,

original: bdag la dngos grub stsal du gsol //
analyzed: bdag la dngos grub stsal du gsol //
translated: I request the spiritual powers.

original: zhes brjod la nam mkha'i rnam snang la sogs pa slob ma bzhi shar la sogs par gnas pas sam /
analyzed: zhes brjod la nam mkha'i rnam snang la sogs pa slob ma bzhi shar la sogs par gnas pas sam /
translated: Having recited this, the four disciples, such as the space-vajra and so on, remain in the east and so on, or

original: gcig gis kyang de dang der song nas /
analyzed: gcig gis kyang de dang der song nas /
translated: even one of them goes to each of those places🔽and recites:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
translated: All tathāgatas are peace,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: the place of all tathāgatas,

original: chos kun mchog tu bdag med pa //
analyzed: chos kun mchog tu bdag med pa //
translated: the supreme selflessness of all phenomena—

original: dkyil 'khor dam ba bshad du gsol //🔽mtshan rnams thams cad yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam ba bshad du gsol // mtshan rnams thams cad yang dag rdzogs //
translated: please explain the sublime maṇḍala.🔽All the perfect characteristics

original: mtshan min thams cad rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: mtshan min thams cad rnam spangs pa //
translated: and all the noncharacteristics are abandoned,🔽the supreme body of Samantabhadra—

original: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po sku yi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
translated: please explain the sublime maṇḍala.

original: zhi ba chos kyi mchog las byung //
analyzed: zhi ba chos kyi mchog las byung //
translated: The supreme peace arises from phenomena,

original: ye shes spyod pa rnam spyod byed //
analyzed: ye shes spyod pa rnam spyod byed //
translated: the conduct of wisdom is practiced,

original: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
analyzed: kun du bzang po gsung gi mchog / dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
translated: please teach the sacred maṇḍala.

original: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi sems chen po //
translated: The great mind of all sentient beings

original: rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag cing dri ma med //
translated: is pure by nature and stainless.

original: kun bzang thugs mchog kha los sgyur //
analyzed: kun bzang thugs mchog kha los sgyur //
translated: Samantabhadra, supreme mind, the one who turns the wheel,

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bstan du gsol //
translated: please teach the sacred maṇḍala.

original: zhes so sor rang nyid la gsol ba 'debs su gzhug go //
analyzed: zhes so sor rang nyid la gsol ba 'debs su gzhug go //
translated: Thus, have them supplicate individually.

original: dngos su gsol ba 'debs pa med na yid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su gsol ba 'debs pa med na yid kyis bya'o //
translated: If there is no actual supplication, do it mentally.

original: de nas yid kyis nam mkha' la gdeg go //
analyzed: de nas yid kyis nam mkha' la gdeg go //
translated: Then, mentally toss it into space.🔽Then, stand up, face east, pay homage to the tathāgatas, and in order to dispel the māras, meditate on Humkara.

original: de nas langs la shar du bltas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal te bdud bsal pa'i phyir h'um mdzad du bsgoms la mig gnyis nyi zla ltar byas la mig 'bras gnyis h'um du byas pa'i bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba'i rdo rje'i lta bas phyogs
analyzed: de nas langs la shar du bltas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal te bdud bsal pa'i phyir h'um mdzad du bsgoms la mig gnyis nyi zla ltar byas la mig 'bras gnyis h'um du byas pa'i bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba'i rdo rje'i lta bas phyogs
translated: With the two eyes like the sun and moon, visualize the two eyeballs as hūṃs, blazing like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: thams cad kyi 'gro ba la blta zhing nga rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'gro ba la blta zhing nga rgyal bskyed la /
translated: With the vajra gaze, look at all migrating beings in all directions, generate pride,🔽and recite:

original: bdag ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
analyzed: bdag ni rang nyid rdo rje can //
translated: I am the one with the vajra.

original: phyag na rdo rje'ang rang nyid bdag / bdag ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'ang rang nyid bdag / bdag ni sangs rgyas rgyal po che //
translated: I am the great king of the buddhas.

original: stobs can rdo rje can bdag yin //
analyzed: stobs can rdo rje can bdag yin //
translated: I am the powerful one, the vajra holder.🔽I am the lord of yogins,

original: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal po bdag / phyag na rdo rje brtan bdag ste //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rgyal po bdag / phyag na rdo rje brtan bdag ste //
translated: I am the firm Vajrapani.🔽I am the lord, the great vajra,

original: bdag po rdo rje chen po bdag / byin gyis brlab pa mi 'dor ro //🔽zhes brjod do //🔽de nas rkang mthil du rdo rje bsgoms te /
analyzed: bdag po rdo rje chen po bdag / byin gyis brlab pa mi 'dor ro // zhes brjod do // de nas rkang mthil du rdo rje bsgoms te /
translated: I do not abandon consecration.🔽Then, having meditated on the vajra at the soles of the feet,

original: 'gying ba'i nga ro dang bcas pa byed cing rdo rje gsor dril bu dkrol zhing rdo rje'i stang stabs kyis dbang ldan du song nas de nas brtsams @228b te slob ma dang lhan cig rdo rje rkang stabs byed cing /
analyzed: 'gying ba'i nga ro dang bcas pa byed cing rdo rje gsor dril bu dkrol zhing rdo rje'i stang stabs kyis dbang ldan du song nas de nas brtsams @228b te slob ma dang lhan cig rdo rje rkang stabs byed cing /
translated: with a haughty roar, one should wave the vajra, ring the bell, and with the vajra gait, go to the northeast. Then, beginning from there, together with the disciple, one should perform the vajra gait.

original: gang bdag gi sa phyogs 'di na gnas pa'i lha dang lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dags dang / sha za dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po dang / mkha' 'gro dang / gnon po dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: gang bdag gi sa phyogs 'di na gnas pa'i lha dang lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / yi dags dang / sha za dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po dang / mkha' 'gro dang / gnon po dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: You gods, demigods, yakshas, rakshasas, pretas, pisacas, bhutas, dakinis, gnomes, kinnaras,🔽and you old men and women who have accomplished mantras, together with your retinues, all of you depart from this place.

original: sngags grub pa rgan po dang / rgan mo 'khor dang bcas pa khyed rnams dengs shig / sa phyogs 'dir bdag rdo rje slob dpon che ge mos sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i yi shes thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma che ge mo'i don du dkyil 'khor che ge mo 'dri bas khyed rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' thos pa tsam gyis myur du dengs shig dang /
analyzed: sngags grub pa rgan po dang / rgan mo 'khor dang bcas pa khyed rnams dengs shig / sa phyogs 'dir bdag rdo rje slob dpon che ge mos sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i yi shes thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma che ge mo'i don du dkyil 'khor che ge mo 'dri bas khyed rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' thos pa tsam gyis myur du dengs shig dang /
translated: Because I, the vajra master so-and-so, will draw the mandala so-and-so for the sake of the disciple so-and-so in order to cause all sentient beings to attain unsurpassed wisdom, you must all depart quickly upon merely hearing the command of Great Vajradhara.

original: gang dag mi 'gro ba de rnams bdag rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis /
analyzed: gang dag mi 'gro ba de rnams bdag rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis /
translated: Those who do not leave, I, Vajra Humkara, will🔽crush their bodies and drink their blood.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba rab tu 'bar ba gsal zhing rab tu gsal ba'i ye shes kyis rdo rje chen pos mgo bo tshal ba brgyar 'gas par 'gyur ro zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba rab tu 'bar ba gsal zhing rab tu gsal ba'i ye shes kyis rdo rje chen pos mgo bo tshal ba brgyar 'gas par 'gyur ro zhes brjod cing /
translated: With the blazing, blazing, blazing, blazing vajra, with the wisdom of the blazing, blazing vajra, the great vajra will split one's head into a hundred pieces.

original: khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs bsal par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo dpag tu med pa spros pas bgegs bsal par bya'o //
translated: Having said this, one should dispel the obstructors by emanating immeasurable wrathful ones.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab po //
translated: One should also bless the ground of the maṇḍala as having the nature of vajra.

original: de nas rdo rje rtse gcig pa rkang pa'i mthil du bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rtse gcig pa rkang pa'i mthil du bsgoms la /
translated: Then, having meditated on the single-pronged vajra on the soles of the feet,

original: sa gzhi la bri zhing gar byed pas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi la bri zhing gar byed pas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw it on the ground and circle it with dancing.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje rtse gsum pa dang / rtse lnga pa dang sna tshogs rdo rjes yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje rtse gsum pa dang / rtse lnga pa dang sna tshogs rdo rjes yang ngo //
translated: After that, one should also circle with the three-pronged vajra, the five-pronged vajra, and the crossed vajra.

original: bskor ba gzhan du phyogs pas rjes 'dod cing re res bskor ba lan gsum gsum bya'o //
analyzed: bskor ba gzhan du phyogs pas rjes 'dod cing re res bskor ba lan gsum gsum bya'o //
translated: One should circle in the other direction, desiring the rear, and circle with each one three times.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod la sa la lag pa reg cing gtso bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas la lha bsgom zhing de nyid du nyal lo ;
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod la sa la lag pa reg cing gtso bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas la lha bsgom zhing de nyid du nyal lo ;
translated: Then, having made offerings to the mandala circle, touch the ground with your hand, recite the principal deity's mantra one hundred and eight times, and recite the one hundred syllable mantra seven times. Meditate on the deity and sleep right there.

original: / sa gzung ba'o //
analyzed: / sa gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the taking of the ground.

original: de nas lcags sam seng ldeng ngam /
analyzed: de nas lcags sam seng ldeng ngam /
translated: Then, take ten daggers made of iron, or of acacia wood,

original: rus pa'i phur pa sor brgyad pa sboms su sor phyed dang gsum pa stod rang rang gi gzugs la smad phur par 'dug pa bcu yungs kar dang tsandan dmar pos byugs la skud pa kha dog lnga pas dkris te rab gnas byas la mchod de snod sar par
analyzed: rus pa'i phur pa sor brgyad pa sboms su sor phyed dang gsum pa stod rang rang gi gzugs la smad phur par 'dug pa bcu yungs kar dang tsandan dmar pos byugs la skud pa kha dog lnga pas dkris te rab gnas byas la mchod de snod sar par
translated: or of bone, eight fingerbreadths long, one and a half fingerbreadths thick, with the upper part in the shape of the deity's form and the lower part in the shape of a dagger. Anoint them with white mustard seed and red sandalwood, wrap them with five colored yarn, consecrate them, make offerings, and place them in a new container.

original: gzhag go // de nas skad cig gis stong pa'i rjes la rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang ra ba dang gur gyi nang du h'um mdzad du rang nyid bsgoms pa'i snying ga'i h'um las 'od 'phros pas bgegs thams cad bkug nas dong du bcug la h'um las 'od 'phros pa'i khro bo
analyzed: gzhag go // de nas skad cig gis stong pa'i rjes la rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang ra ba dang gur gyi nang du h'um mdzad du rang nyid bsgoms pa'i snying ga'i h'um las 'od 'phros pas bgegs thams cad bkug nas dong du bcug la h'um las 'od 'phros pa'i khro bo
translated: Then, after the instant emptiness, meditate on yourself as Humkara inside the vajra ground, fence, and tent. Light shines from the hum at the heart, summoning all obstructors and forcing them into the pit. Light shines from hum, and wrathful ones
Ten🔽

original: la gtad do //
analyzed: la gtad do //
translated: One should cast them.

original: de rnams kyi aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya sarba bighn'am h'um gis gdab /
analyzed: de rnams kyi aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya sarba bighn'am h'um gis gdab /
translated: With the mantra of those, “Om Vajra Kilikila Sarva Vighanān Hūṃ,” one should strike.

original: aom badzra mudga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes brdung bar bsgoms la /
analyzed: aom badzra mudga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes brdung bar bsgoms la /
translated: Meditating on “Om Vajra Mudgara Ākoṭaya Hūṃ,” one should beat.

original: de rang nyid kyis kyang dbang ldan nas g-yas skor du 'od kyi phreng ba'i phyogs mtshams brgyad dang / steng 'og gi shar nub tu gdab cing brdung ngo //
analyzed: de rang nyid kyis kyang dbang ldan nas g-yas skor du 'od kyi phreng ba'i phyogs mtshams brgyad dang / steng 'og gi shar nub tu gdab cing brdung ngo //
translated: One should cast and beat in the eight directions and above and below, beginning from the northeast in a clockwise circle.

original: mi nus na sgo skyong gis so //
analyzed: mi nus na sgo skyong gis so //
translated: If one is unable to do that, the door guardians should do it.

original: yang na phur pa med par ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa kho nas gdab pa dang brdung ba byas la lag pa gan rkyal du gnas pas bsgyur zhing /
analyzed: yang na phur pa med par ji skad bshad pa'i bsgom pa kho nas gdab pa dang brdung ba byas la lag pa gan rkyal du gnas pas bsgyur zhing /
translated: Or else, without a kīla, one should cast and beat with the meditation as explained, turning one’s hand over.

original: aom badzra a'a:h'um zhes brjod cing sa la bsnun te de ltar mos pas bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a:h'um zhes brjod cing sa la bsnun te de ltar mos pas bya'o //
translated: Reciting “Om Vajra Āḥ Hūṃ,” one should strike the ground, doing it with that visualization.

original: bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'o //
translated: That is the casting of the kīla at the obstructors.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: Then, sitting in the center of the maṇḍala,

original: dri'i dkyil 'khor byas par sa'i lha mo las dam tshig sems dpa' bsgoms nas /
analyzed: dri'i dkyil 'khor byas par sa'i lha mo las dam tshig sems dpa' bsgoms nas /
translated: one should meditate on the pledge beings from the earth goddess in the scented maṇḍala.

original: lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du h'um bsams te sor mo rtse gsum lan gsum du bsnun pa dang de'i sgra dang h'um gi 'od zer gyis bskul pa'i sa'i lha mo ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo dang 'dres par gyur pa dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thugs can ser
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa'i mthil du h'um bsams te sor mo rtse gsum lan gsum du bsnun pa dang de'i sgra dang h'um gi 'od zer gyis bskul pa'i sa'i lha mo ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo dang 'dres par gyur pa dga' ba dang ldan pa'i thugs can ser
translated: The sound of that and the light rays of the hūṃ invoke the earth goddess, who becomes of the nature of the gnosis being.

original: mo zhi ba na bza' dkar po bsnams pa /
analyzed: mo zhi ba na bza' dkar po bsnams pa /
translated: She is yellow, peaceful, and delighted, holding a white silken garment.

original: rgyan cha sna tshogs pa can g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis gser gyi bum pa bzang po bsnams shing /
analyzed: rgyan cha sna tshogs pa can g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis gser gyi bum pa bzang po bsnams shing /
translated: She has various ornaments and holds an excellent golden vase in her left and right hands.🔽She has one face and is facing forward.

original: mi 'jig pa mdzad pa zhal gcig pa mdun du gnas pa la mchod de yang dag par bskor ba dang bcas pas /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa mdzad pa zhal gcig pa mdun du gnas pa la mchod de yang dag par bskor ba dang bcas pas /
translated: Make offerings and circumambulate.

original: aom tshur spyon sa yi lha mo che //
analyzed: aom tshur spyon sa yi lha mo che //
translated: oṃ come here come here great goddess of the earth

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi ni yum //🔽rin chen kun gyis rnam par spras //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi ni yum // rin chen kun gyis rnam par spras //
translated: mother of all worlds🔽adorned with all jewels

original: bzang po'i rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: bzang po'i rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with excellent ornaments

original: do shal rkang gdub sgra dang ldan //
analyzed: do shal rkang gdub sgra dang ldan //
translated: with the sound of a necklace and anklets

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod pa //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab mchod pa //
translated: adorning Vajrasattva

original: mchod yon 'di ni bzhes nas kyang //
analyzed: mchod yon 'di ni bzhes nas kyang //
translated: Having accepted this water for the feet,

original: dkyil 'khor las ni grub par mdzod //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor las ni grub par mdzod //
translated: please accomplish the maṇḍala.

original: hi hi hi hi h'um sv'a h'a zhes lan gsum brjod pas spyan drang ba dang nye bar gnas par gsol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: hi hi hi hi h'um sv'a h'a zhes lan gsum brjod pas spyan drang ba dang nye bar gnas par gsol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having invited with “Hi hi hi hi hūṃ svāhā” three times, one should perform the consecration, preceded by the request to remain near.

original: des kyang de ltar gyis shig ces brjod nas de nyid du thim par bsam /
analyzed: des kyang de ltar gyis shig ces brjod nas de nyid du thim par bsam /
translated: “Do it that way,” he says, and one should imagine that he dissolves into oneself.

original: de nas rdo rje bcing ba nang du byas nas des sa la reg cing /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bcing ba nang du byas nas des sa la reg cing /
translated: Then, having made the vajra bond inside, one touches the ground with it,

original: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um zhes lan gsum brjod nas /
analyzed: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um zhes lan gsum brjod nas /
translated: and recites “Oṃ vajra bhūmi aḥ” three times.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i h'um 'bar ba spros pas dbang chen gyi rdo rjer bsams nas /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i h'um 'bar ba spros pas dbang chen gyi rdo rjer bsams nas /
translated: Having imagined that the blazing hūṃ that arises from the vajra bond is the great lord’s vajra,

original: aom badzra @229b dri dha tishta zhes lan gsum brjod pas byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: aom badzra @229b dri dha tishta zhes lan gsum brjod pas byin gyis brlab /
translated: one should consecrate with “Oṃ vajra dhātu tiṣṭha” three times.

original: des nis dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: des nis dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sa'i lha mo lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: By that, the earth is brought under control. This is the rite of the consecration of the earth goddess.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la dri zhim pa'i chu bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pas byug pa dang me tog gi gcal dgram pa dang / phyi dro khrus byas shing dri zhim pos bsgos la gos sar pa gyon pa me tog phreng ba can /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi la dri zhim pa'i chu bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pas byug pa dang me tog gi gcal dgram pa dang / phyi dro khrus byas shing dri zhim pos bsgos la gos sar pa gyon pa me tog phreng ba can /
translated: In the evening, after bathing and anointing oneself with fragrance, wearing new clothes, and wearing a flower garland,

original: kha dri zhim pos bsgos la do shal dang sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba dang / aom badzroshn'i sha h'um phat ces pa dag go rims bzhin du bsngags pa'i ras sam dar dmar po'i cod pan gyis brgyan nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su shar gyi phyogs par 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: kha dri zhim pos bsgos la do shal dang sor gdub la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba dang / aom badzroshn'i sha h'um phat ces pa dag go rims bzhin du bsngags pa'i ras sam dar dmar po'i cod pan gyis brgyan nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su shar gyi phyogs par 'dug pa'am /
translated: one should consecrate the mouth with fragrance and consecrate the ornaments, such as necklaces and rings, with the respective mantras, “oṃ āḥ hūṃ svāhā” and “oṃ vajroṣṇīṣa hūṃ phaṭ,” and adorn oneself with a red silk ribbon or cloth.🔽One should sit in the center of the maṇḍala, facing east,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas nub tu phyogs par 'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas nub tu phyogs par 'dug kyang rung /
translated: or facing west in the east of the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar la sogs su gnas nas sam byang du phyogs pas dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bum pa lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bsgom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar la sogs su gnas nas sam byang du phyogs pas dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bum pa lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: One who is endowed with the yoga of the lord of the mandala should reside in the east, etc., outside the mandala of meditation, or facing north, in the northeast corner, and consecrate the vase.

original: de la zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i bum pa dag gi nang du ni sor bcu drug go //
analyzed: de la zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i bum pa dag gi nang du ni sor bcu drug go //
translated: In that case, the vases for pacifying and increasing are sixteen finger-breadths in height.

original: lte ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i bar gyi dpangs su sor nyi shu'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'og nas kha dang mchu'i bar gyi dpangs su sor nyi shu'o //
translated: From the navel to the mouth and lips is twenty finger-breadths.

original: kha'i mtshams nas mchu 'phyang ba'i bar ni sor gnyis so //
analyzed: kha'i mtshams nas mchu 'phyang ba'i bar ni sor gnyis so //
translated: From the mouth to the hanging lips is two finger-breadths.

original: mgrin pa ni sor drug go //
analyzed: mgrin pa ni sor drug go //
translated: The throat is six finger-breadths.

original: mchu'i bar gyi kha ni sor brgyad do //
analyzed: mchu'i bar gyi kha ni sor brgyad do //
translated: The mouth between the lips is eight finger-breadths.

original: sor brgyad pa'i cha gnyis ni mgul pa'i sbubs so //
analyzed: sor brgyad pa'i cha gnyis ni mgul pa'i sbubs so //
translated: Two parts of eight finger-breadths are the neck of the vase.

original: cha gcig ni mchu gnyis kyi dpangs so //
analyzed: cha gcig ni mchu gnyis kyi dpangs so //
translated: One part is the height of the two lips.

original: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag la ni lto ba'i rgya la sor bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: dbye ba dang bskrad pa dag la ni lto ba'i rgya la sor bcu gnyis so //
translated: For the divisions and expelling, the belly is twelve finger-breadths in diameter.

original: dpangs su sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o ;
analyzed: dpangs su sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o ;
translated: The height is twenty-four finger-breadths.

original: / rked pa ni sor brgyad do //
analyzed: / rked pa ni sor brgyad do //
translated: The waist is eight finger-breadths.

original: kha ni sor drug go //
analyzed: kha ni sor drug go //
translated: The mouth is six finger-breadths.

original: 'di'i mchu gnyis ni sor mo re'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mchu gnyis ni sor mo re'o //
translated: Each of its lips is one finger-breadth.

original: dbang dang dgug pa dag gi bum pa ni bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa dag gi bum pa ni bzo bos ji ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The vase for subjugation and attraction is made by an artisan as it is described.

original: rengs pa la ni thung zhing zlum pa la dpangs su sor bcu drug go //
analyzed: rengs pa la ni thung zhing zlum pa la dpangs su sor bcu drug go //
translated: For immobilization, it is short and round, sixteen finger-breadths in height.

original: mgrin pa la ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa la ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The neck is four finger-breadths.

original: sor drug ni 'di'i rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: sor drug ni 'di'i rtsibs su'o //
translated: Six finger-breadths are for its spout.🔽For all activities, one should take the vases described for the activities of pacification and so forth.

original: las thams cad pa la ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las su gsungs pa'i bum pa rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs la /
analyzed: las thams cad pa la ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las su gsungs pa'i bum pa rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes dus kyi 'khor lo las gsungs la /
translated: This is stated in the Kālacakra Tantra.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyud rnams las ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyud rnams las ni /
translated: In other tantras, it is said:

original: rtsa ba nag por ri med //
analyzed: rtsa ba nag por ri med //
translated: The base is black, without lines.

original: mchu 'phyang mgrin ring lto ba che //
analyzed: mchu 'phyang mgrin ring lto ba che //
translated: The spout is long, the neck long, the belly large.

original: @230a * // bum pa rnams de ltar brjod pa yang sor bcu drug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @230a * // bum pa rnams de ltar brjod pa yang sor bcu drug pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The description of the vases should be understood in terms of sixteen finger-breadths and so forth.

original: 'dir gser la sogs pa'i bum pa rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am yang na ji ltar rnyed pa yang bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir gser la sogs pa'i bum pa rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am yang na ji ltar rnyed pa yang bzung ste /
translated: Here, a vase made of gold and so forth, possessing the characteristics taught in the tantras, or alternatively, whatever is available, should be taken.

original: zhi ba'am rgyas pa'i don du 'bras btags pa'am mthong lo kor ram tsandan gyi lde gu dkar pos byas la sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte pa'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i lha'i sa bon dang phyag mtshan bri bar byas la bdud
analyzed: zhi ba'am rgyas pa'i don du 'bras btags pa'am mthong lo kor ram tsandan gyi lde gu dkar pos byas la sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte pa'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i lha'i sa bon dang phyag mtshan bri bar byas la bdud
translated: For the purpose of pacifying or increasing, make a paste of rice or of white sandalwood and camphor, and draw the seed syllables and implements of the deities on the center of an eight-petaled lotus, on a moon and sun seat.

original: rtsi lnga dang dri zhim po'i chu sa bkad la rin po che lnga dang / sman lnga dang / 'bru lnga nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: rtsi lnga dang dri zhim po'i chu sa bkad la rin po che lnga dang / sman lnga dang / 'bru lnga nang du bcug ste /
translated: Mix the five elixirs and fragrant water with the earth of an anthill, and insert the five precious substances, the five medicines, and the five grains.🔽Cover the opening with a leaf of an amra and so on, and tie it with two pieces of cloth that have fringes and are adorned with flower garlands.

original: aa mra la sogs pa'i lo mas kha brgyan pa dang / ske la me tog gi phreng ba dang bcas pa'i ras kha tshar ma nyams pa gnyis bcings pa rnams bla re'i 'og tu mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pas so sor bris pa'i mandala gyi steng du dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par mdun du ku sha'i steng du bkod nas
analyzed: aa mra la sogs pa'i lo mas kha brgyan pa dang / ske la me tog gi phreng ba dang bcas pa'i ras kha tshar ma nyams pa gnyis bcings pa rnams bla re'i 'og tu mtshan ma dgod pa'i rim pas so sor bris pa'i mandala gyi steng du dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par mdun du ku sha'i steng du bkod nas
translated: Place them under the canopy in the order of the signs, and arrange them in the form of a mandala on the kuśa grass in front, on the drawn maṇḍala.

original: h'um lan bdun du bzlas pa'i thig skud dkar po bdun gyis aom badzra shi ka re ru ta ma ta di sham bandha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: h'um lan bdun du bzlas pa'i thig skud dkar po bdun gyis aom badzra shi ka re ru ta ma ta di sham bandha h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: One should wind the white thread around seven times, repeating the syllable HŪM seven times, with the mantra OṂ VAJRA ŚIKHARA RUDRA MAT

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i kha dog can lnga rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan du'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las dang mthun pa'i kha dog can lnga rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan du'o //
translated: The five colors are in accordance with the rite of pacification, etc.🔽The five precious substances are pearl, gold, ruby, coral, and sapphire.

original: rin po che lnga ni mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang / byi ru dang / mu men dang / padma r'a ga ma rnyed na dngul lam zangs sam dung yang rung ngo //
analyzed: rin po che lnga ni mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang / byi ru dang / mu men dang / padma r'a ga ma rnyed na dngul lam zangs sam dung yang rung ngo //
translated: If a ruby is not available, silver, copper, or conch shell is suitable.

original: mu men gyi gnas su nor bu yang rung ngo //
analyzed: mu men gyi gnas su nor bu yang rung ngo //
translated: In place of sapphire, a jewel is suitable.

original: dbul nas ma 'byor pa ni rnam par rgyal ba dang las thams cad pa'i bum pa rin po che dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: dbul nas ma 'byor pa ni rnam par rgyal ba dang las thams cad pa'i bum pa rin po che dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Having offered them, one should fill the victorious vase and the vase for all activities with precious substances, if they are not available.

original: bum pa gzhan la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: bum pa gzhan la ni ma yin no /
translated: But not in other vases.

original: de la yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa nges par rin po che dang ldan bar rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa nges par rin po che dang ldan bar rig bar bya'o //
translated: And in that case, one should understand that the victorious vase is definitely filled with precious substances.

original: sman lnga ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / dandotpa la dkar po dang / dbang po lag pa dang / aa ba r'a dzi ta dkar po rnams so //🔽'bru lnga ni til dang / nas dang / mon sran dang / 'bras dang / so ba dang gro rnams so //🔽kha cig tu 'bras so sran gre'u'o //

translated: The five medicines are brihati, kantakari, white dhatri, indra-basti, and white avra.🔽The five grains are sesame, barley, beans, rice, and wheat.🔽In some cases, rice is substituted for beans.🔽🔽

translated: In the other vases, on the moon or sun according to the case, on the lotus of the deities are the signs or seed-syllable.

original: 'khor lo lnga la so sor re re ste lnga'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo lnga la so sor re re ste lnga'o //
translated: In the five wheels, there are five each, one in each.

original: yang na pho brang du gnas pa kho na'i lnga'o //
analyzed: yang na pho brang du gnas pa kho na'i lnga'o //
translated: Or else, there are five in the palace alone.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi lnga dang 'khor lo bzhi bzhi ste dgu'o //🔽yang na dbus kyi pho brang dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams khyi ni bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi lnga dang 'khor lo bzhi bzhi ste dgu'o // yang na dbus kyi pho brang dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo la gnas pa rnams khyi ni bcu gsum mo //

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig dang mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyogs su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig dang mtshams su gnas pa rnams kyi gcig go //
translated: Or else, there are thirteen, those in the central palace and in the wheel of commitment, one of those in the wheel of mind, and one of those in the intermediate directions.

original: de ltar gsung ge 'khor lo dang sku'i 'khor lo la yang yin te bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsung ge 'khor lo dang sku'i 'khor lo la yang yin te bcu dgu'o //
translated: Thus, there are nineteen, those in the wheel of speech and in the wheel of body.

original: phyogs 'di rnams su lha so sor dgod pa la las thams cad pa'i dum skyes ma ni lhag par dgod do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di rnams su lha so sor dgod pa la las thams cad pa'i dum skyes ma ni lhag par dgod do //
translated: In these directions, one should arrange the individual deities, and in addition, one should arrange the smoky-colored Caṇḍī who performs all deeds.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs pas bum pa'i grangs rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs pas dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar rigs pas bum pa'i grangs rig par bya'o //
translated: Since one follows that, one should understand the number of vases in other mandalas as appropriate.🔽Since it is the principal one, on top of the victory vase, in a conch shell or a lotus vessel, one should consecrate the vase with the five elixirs and fragrant water with hūṃ, and the nature of the vajra particles

original: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du dung chos sam padma'i snod du h'um gis bsngags pa'i ji ltar snyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu ye shes kyi bdud rtsir byas pa'i rdo rje rdul phra rab
analyzed: de la gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa'i steng du dung chos sam padma'i snod du h'um gis bsngags pa'i ji ltar snyed pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po'i chu ye shes kyi bdud rtsir byas pa'i rdo rje rdul phra rab
translated: of the vase and its contents should be made into the elixir of wisdom.

original: kyi rang bzhin bum pa bcud dang bcas pa de rnams skad cig gis stong pa nyid du byas la /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin bum pa bcud dang bcas pa de rnams skad cig gis stong pa nyid du byas la /
translated: In an instant, one should make that into emptiness.

original: bhr'um gyi yi ge las bum pa rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi gzhal yas khang du bsgoms la /
analyzed: bhr'um gyi yi ge las bum pa rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi gzhal yas khang du bsgoms la /
translated: From the syllable bhrūṃ, one should meditate on the vase as a celestial mansion with the nature of a precious gem.

original: aom badzra aa mri to da ka h'um zhes lan bdun brjod la 'bru gsum gyis lan gsum du bsngags te me tog gi phreng bas bcings pa'i rdo rje bzhag nas de nas aom tapte te pte ma h'a tapte sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra aa mri to da ka h'um zhes lan bdun brjod la 'bru gsum gyis lan gsum du bsngags te me tog gi phreng bas bcings pa'i rdo rje bzhag nas de nas aom tapte te pte ma h'a tapte sv'a h'a /
translated: Saying Oṃ vajra-amṛta odaka haṃ seven times, and with the three seed syllables, one should consecrate the water three times. Having placed the vajra bound with a garland of flowers, then one should say Oṃ taṭa taṭa mahā taṭa svāhā.

original: lan bdun bdun brjod pas dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i chu'i rang bzhin du bkug la bcug ste chur lha'i gdan dang bcas pa skad cig gis bsams la rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mdun du bkug la mchod yon dang zhal🔽bsil byin la yang dag par mchod de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bcug la chags pa chen pos zhu bar gyur ba'i byang chub @231a * //
analyzed: lan bdun bdun brjod pas dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i chu'i rang bzhin du bkug la bcug ste chur lha'i gdan dang bcas pa skad cig gis bsams la rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mdun du bkug la mchod yon dang zhal bsil byin la yang dag par mchod de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bcug la chags pa chen pos zhu bar gyur ba'i byang chub @231a * //
translated: Having said that seven times, one should summon the water of the mandala deities and cause them to enter. In an instant, one should imagine the water with the seats of the deities. Having summoned the awareness mandala in front with the light rays of the seed syllable in one’s heart, one should offer a welcome gift and rinse the mouth.

original: kyi sems kyi ngo bo mngon du byas pa de dang ro gcig tu gyur par bsam /
analyzed: kyi sems kyi ngo bo mngon du byas pa de dang ro gcig tu gyur par bsam /
translated: Having made perfect offerings, one should cause the awareness beings to enter the commitment beings and imagine that they become of the same taste as the bodhicitta that becomes the nature of great passion.

original: mtshan ma la yang dam tshig gi lha dang ye shes kyi lha gcig tu gyur pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la yang dam tshig gi lha dang ye shes kyi lha gcig tu gyur pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the deity of the pledge and the deity of pristine awareness become one.

original: de nas h'um zhes brjod cing rdo rje dang 'brel pa'i me tog gi phreng ba dang ldan pa g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung la aom badzra au da ka h'um zhes lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad chu la bsngags par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas h'um zhes brjod cing rdo rje dang 'brel pa'i me tog gi phreng ba dang ldan pa g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyis bzung la aom badzra au da ka h'um zhes lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad chu la bsngags par bya'o //
translated: Then, saying hūṃ, holding the flower garland connected with the vajra and held with the left fist, one should enchant the water with oṃ vajra-udaka-hūṃ one hundred and eight times.

original: yang na 'khor lo'i bdag po'i snying po bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'khor lo'i bdag po'i snying po bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Or one should recite the essence mantra of the lord of the wheel.

original: de nas aom a'a: bighn'am ta krita h'um zhes bdud rtsi 'khyil pas bsngags la me tog dkar po gsum gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom a'a: bighn'am ta krita h'um zhes bdud rtsi 'khyil pas bsngags la me tog dkar po gsum gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, saying oṃ āḥ vighanāntakṛt hūṃ, one should enchant the water with Vighnāntakṛt and insert three white flowers.

original: bum pa gzhan lha gang dang gang gi yin pa de dang de'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun du bzlas shing steng gi rdo rje'i mig gi phreng ba'i mthar bzung nas de ltar me tog gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa gzhan lha gang dang gang gi yin pa de dang de'i sngags kyis brgya rtsa brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun du bzlas shing steng gi rdo rje'i mig gi phreng ba'i mthar bzung nas de ltar me tog gzhug par bya'o //
translated: For the other vases, one should enchant the water with the mantra of the respective deity one hundred and eight, twenty-one, or seven times, and then insert the flowers.

original: de nas rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams me tog la sogs pas mchod nas bsrung ba'i don du las thams cad pa'i chus de'i lo mas bsangs te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams me tog la sogs pas mchod nas bsrung ba'i don du las thams cad pa'i chus de'i lo mas bsangs te /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the vases such as the victorious vase with flowers, and so on, in order to protect them, cleanse with water from the activity vase and leaves.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rnams rdzogs par gyur pa de srid du bgegs rnams zlog par mdzod cig ces brjod cing gtor ma yang nye bar reg ste /
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba rnams rdzogs par gyur pa de srid du bgegs rnams zlog par mdzod cig ces brjod cing gtor ma yang nye bar reg ste /
translated: Here, one should say, “Until the activities of the maṇḍala are complete, please avert the obstructors,” and also offer a torma.

original: mi bskyod pa ni ye shes che //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni ye shes che //
translated: Akṣobhya is great timeless awareness,

original: rdo rje dbyings ni mkha' chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings ni mkha' chen po //
translated: the vajra realm, the great space,

original: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum ;
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum ;
translated: the supreme three vajras, the three maṇḍalas,

original: / rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: / rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: homage and praise to the vajra realm.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
translated: Vairocana is great purity,

original: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba dga' ba che //
translated: the vajra peace, the great joy,🔽the supreme, sublime natural luminosity,

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: homage and praise to the vajra teacher.

original: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
translated: The precious king is very profound,

original: rdo rje nam mkha' 'dri ma med //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' 'dri ma med //
translated: the vajra space, stainless,

original: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med ;
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med ;
translated: uncontaminated by a natural purity,🔽homage and praise to the vajra space.🔽Ratnasaṃbhava is the great desire,🔽the vajra desire, the great delight,🔽the supreme, sublime natural luminosity,🔽homage and praise to the vajra desire.

original: / rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: / rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise the vajra body.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //
translated: Vajra Amṛta, great king,

original: mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: nonconceptual space-vajra holder,

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa thob //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa thob //
translated: attained the perfection of desire.

original: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise vajra speech.

original: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: Amoghavajra, perfect buddha,

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
translated: accomplisher of all wishes,

original: rang bzhin dag pas yang dag byung //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas yang dag byung //
translated: arisen from pure nature.

original: rdo rje sems la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje sems la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise vajra mind.

original: ces bstod pa sngon du song bas dril bu dkrol zhing dung chos sam padma'i snod du chu nyung du blugs la steng du rdo rje bzhag ste bum pa'i steng du gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: dam pa bdag gis bskyed pa bgyi nas //

analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir // bdag gis sngom pa ma lus gzung // ma brgal pa rnams bdag gis bsgral //

original: ma grol ba ni dgrol bar bgyi //
analyzed: ma grol ba ni dgrol bar bgyi //
translated: Those not freed I will free,

original: dbugs ma phyung la dbugs dbyung ste //
analyzed: dbugs ma phyung la dbugs dbyung ste //
translated: I will give relief to those unrelieved,

original: sems can mya ngan 'das la dgod ;
analyzed: sems can mya ngan 'das la dgod ;
translated: and I will lead to Nirvana those sentient beings who have not attained Nirvana.

original: / ces lan gsum du'o //
analyzed: / ces lan gsum du'o //
translated: This is repeated three times.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i cho ga'o //🔽de nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas de dag gi snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo rnams la h'um a'a:/
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i cho ga'o // de nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas de dag gi snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo rnams la h'um a'a:/
translated: This is the rite for generating the Thought of Enlightenment.🔽Then, having protected them with the mantra of Amrtakundali, one should imagine at their heart, throat, and head, a black, red, and white hum, ah, and om.

original: aom nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po bsams nas de rnams brjod cing snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mgo bo rnams la dri chu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dang ldan pa'i khu tshur g-yas pa reg cing mgo bo la me tog dang mdun du spos dang mar me ni snying ga ste dri yang sbyin no //
analyzed: aom nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po bsams nas de rnams brjod cing snying ga dang mgrin pa dang / mgo bo rnams la dri chu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dang ldan pa'i khu tshur g-yas pa reg cing mgo bo la me tog dang mdun du spos dang mar me ni snying ga ste dri yang sbyin no //
translated: Reciting those, one should touch the heart, throat, and head with the right vajra-fist together with water for the mouth, and place a flower on their head. In front of them, one should offer incense, a lamp, and scent at the heart.

original: de'i rjes la aa shvadtha la sogs pa'i so shing sor bcu gnyis pa drang zhing srog chags med pa ma gas pa rma med pa dri zhim po'i chus bskus pa rtse mo me tog gis bcings la byang du phyogs te slob ma rnams la sbyin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la aa shvadtha la sogs pa'i so shing sor bcu gnyis pa drang zhing srog chags med pa ma gas pa rma med pa dri zhim po'i chus bskus pa rtse mo me tog gis bcings la byang du phyogs te slob ma rnams la sbyin no //
translated: After that, one should give the students the tooth sticks, such as the aśoka tree, which are twelve fingerbreadths long, straight, without living creatures, not broken, not rotten, and anointed with fragrant substances, with their tips bound with flowers, facing north.

original: de rnams kyis kyang gru bzhi khru gang ba'i mandala lci bas byugs par shar ram byang du phyogs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang gru bzhi khru gang ba'i mandala lci bas byugs par shar ram byang du phyogs te /
translated: They should face east or north on a square maṇḍala smeared with cow dung,

original: so shing de aom badzra h'a sa h'a zhes brjod nas rtse mo 'chos te steng du blta zhing ma gas pa de ltos pa med par mdun du dor ro //
analyzed: so shing de aom badzra h'a sa h'a zhes brjod nas rtse mo 'chos te steng du blta zhing ma gas pa de ltos pa med par mdun du dor ro //
translated: and having chewed the tooth stick, saying Oṃ vajra-hāsā, they should look upward, and without hesitation, throw it forward.

original: de rnams la so shing lhung ba'i rjes su 'brangs te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos grub brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la so shing lhung ba'i rjes su 'brangs te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos grub brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should tell them the siddhi that will arise in accordance with the way the tooth stick falls.

original: shar dang byang dang nub dang lho dang steng dang 'og tu phyogs par ltung na rim pa bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang mngon spyod dang rig pa 'dzin pa @233b dang sa 'og gi dngos grub rnams so //
analyzed: shar dang byang dang nub dang lho dang steng dang 'og tu phyogs par ltung na rim pa bzhin du zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang mngon spyod dang rig pa 'dzin pa @233b dang sa 'og gi dngos grub rnams so //
translated: If it falls in the east, north, west, south, above, or below, then [the adept] will attain, respectively, pacification, increase, power, assault, the state of a knowledge-holder, or the power of the underworld.

original: mandala gyi ngos su lhung na dngos grub med do //
analyzed: mandala gyi ngos su lhung na dngos grub med do //
translated: If it falls on the side of the maṇḍala, there is no power.

original: de'i rjes su bam gyi yi ge las skyes pa de nyid bzlas pa'i chus kha bkru ba'i phyir mthor 'thung byin nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa lan bdun du bzlas pa'i chu 'khyor ba gsum la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bam gyi yi ge las skyes pa de nyid bzlas pa'i chus kha bkru ba'i phyir mthor 'thung byin nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa lan bdun du bzlas pa'i chu 'khyor ba gsum la /
translated: After that, having given [the disciple] water for washing the mouth, which is produced from the syllable vaṃ and is enchanted with [the mantra] of that [Buddha], and having made him drink it, he should be made to drink three handfuls of water enchanted seven times with Amṛtakuṇḍali.🔽[The disciple] should drink it while reciting:

original: aom hr'i: bi shuddha: sarba dharm'a p'a pa ni tsa aa /🔽mu k'a sya sho dha ya sarba bi kawa na aa pa na ya h'um zhes 'don zhing blud par bya'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: bi shuddha: sarba dharm'a p'a pa ni tsa aa /🔽mu k'a sya sho dha ya sarba bi kawa na aa pa na ya h'um zhes 'don zhing blud par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ viśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāṇāṃ pāpaṃ nicayaśodhaya🔽sarva-vikīrṇa-anāpaya hūṃ.

original: de nas de rnams kyi phyi ngos su bkod nas h'um las byung zhing de bzlas pa'am 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i ku sha mang po rtse mo ma bcad pa nyal ba'i stan gyi don du byin no //
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyi phyi ngos su bkod nas h'um las byung zhing de bzlas pa'am 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i ku sha mang po rtse mo ma bcad pa nyal ba'i stan gyi don du byin no //
translated: Then, having arranged them on the outside of those, he should give many kuśa blades, which have arisen from hūṃ and are recited with that [mantra] or with the recitation of the coiled [one], with their tips uncut, for the purpose of a bed.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi don du yi ge ddh'i: las skyes pa'i ku sha chun po gcig la 'khyil pa bzlas la aom badzra t'i kshna bam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi don du yi ge ddh'i: las skyes pa'i ku sha chun po gcig la 'khyil pa bzlas la aom badzra t'i kshna bam /
translated: In the same way, for the purpose of the mantra, he should give a bundle of kuśa grass arisen from the syllable dhih, which is recited with the coiled [one], with the mantra oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa vaṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis sbyin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis sbyin no //
translated: With that mantra he should give it.

original: de la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i skud pa dmar po slob ma'i lus kyi tshad sum sgril byas la 'khyil pa lan bdun bzlas pa'i mdud pa gsum mam bdun byas pa de rnams kyi dpung pa g-yas pa'am lag pa g-yon par rgyud gzhan du bshad pa'i aom
analyzed: de la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i skud pa dmar po slob ma'i lus kyi tshad sum sgril byas la 'khyil pa lan bdun bzlas pa'i mdud pa gsum mam bdun byas pa de rnams kyi dpung pa g-yas pa'am lag pa g-yon par rgyud gzhan du bshad pa'i aom
translated: On that, a red thread arisen from the syllable hūṃ, the size of the disciple's body, should be tripled, and with the coiled [one] recited seven times, it should be tied with three or seven knots. Those should be placed on the right shoulder or the left hand, with the mantra explained in other tantras, oṃ vajra-śṛīṃ kheṭa khaṃ.

original: buddha mee tree raksha raksha sarba ntu sv'a h'a zhes 'don zhing rang nyid kyis bcings la yang dag par bsrungs te spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: buddha mee tree raksha raksha sarba ntu sv'a h'a zhes 'don zhing rang nyid kyis bcings la yang dag par bsrungs te spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Reciting “Buddha Maitreya rakṣa rakṣa sarvaṃ tu svāhā,” bind oneself, guard oneself well, and generate enthusiasm.

original: bskal pa bye ba du ma ru //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba du ma ru //

original: de nas shar du dri chu dang bdud rtsi lnga dang ba'i rnam lngas bsang zhing dri dang me tog dang rdzas kyis mchod de lag par reg cing 'khyil pas bsrung ngo //

translated: Then, in the east, one should purify with water for the mouth and the five ambrosias and the five products of a cow, and one should worship with perfumes, flowers, and substances, and one should touch it with one's hand and protect it with the Kila mantra.

original: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu dang yungs kar dang dri'i chus gtor te /
analyzed: las thams cad pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu dang yungs kar dang dri'i chus gtor te /
translated: One should sprinkle it with water, mustard seed, and perfumed water, while reciting the mantra of all activities.

original: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas par rig ste aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes brjod nas yi ge gsum brgya rtsa brgyad brjod de lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang bcas pa'i lag pa g-yas par rig ste aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes brjod nas yi ge gsum brgya rtsa brgyad brjod de lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate it with the right hand together with the vajra, saying Oṃ vajra-samaya-sūtra-mātrikrama hūṃ, and one should recite the three syllables one hundred and eight times.

original: yang dkyil 'khor gyi sa la aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pas bum pa thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas la dris byugs nas me tog bkram sten ma mkha' la dkyil 'khor dmigs te mchod bstod bya'o //
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor gyi sa la aom sarba sam sho dha ni h'um phat ces pas bum pa thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas la dris byugs nas me tog bkram sten ma mkha' la dkyil 'khor dmigs te mchod bstod bya'o //
translated: Again, on the site of the maṇḍala, one should sprinkle it with water from all the vases, saying Oṃ sarva-śodhani hūṃ phaṭ, and one should anoint it with perfume, scatter flowers, and visualize the maṇḍala in the sky, and one should make offerings and praises.

translated: Also, with jja jja jja sa, they lead the thread from the southeast to the northeast in the sky, and with the right hand with the vajra, they draw the two Brahma lines.

analyzed: se gol gyi sgra bya'o //

original: thig gi sgras sangs rgyas thams cad bskul nas thig skud la bstim mo //🔽thig gdab pa thams cad du aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um h'um /
