translated: All the buddhas are summoned by the sound of the thread and dissolve into the thread.🔽At all the thread-crossings, one should say oṃ vajra samaya sūtra mātrikrama hūṃ hūṃ.

original: aom sarba aa ha zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba aa ha zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: And oṃ sarva aṃ.

original: de ltar sa'i gnyis kyang ngo //🔽me'i mtshams nas rlung du'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa'i gnyis kyang ngo // me'i mtshams nas rlung du'o //
translated: In that way, the two lines of the earth.🔽From the southeast to the northeast.

original: bden bral nas dbang ldan mtshams su gad ba bo //
analyzed: bden bral nas dbang ldan mtshams su gad ba bo //
translated: From the southwest to the northwest.

original: me'i mtshams su gnas te shar gyi rtsa thig 'khor lo'i mtshams su gdab bo //
analyzed: me'i mtshams su gnas te shar gyi rtsa thig 'khor lo'i mtshams su gdab bo //
translated: One should remain at the fire corner and drive in the eastern thread at the wheel corner.

original: rlung nas nub kyi'o //
analyzed: rlung nas nub kyi'o //
translated: From the wind corner, the western one.

original: de nas byang gi'o //
analyzed: de nas byang gi'o //
translated: Then, the northern one.

original: me nas lho'i'o //
analyzed: me nas lho'i'o //
translated: From the fire corner, the southern one.

original: thig de'i gcig gi brgyad cha sgo yin no //
analyzed: thig de'i gcig gi brgyad cha sgo yin no //
translated: One eighth of that thread is the door.

original: de nas hi hi zhes brjod nas sgo'i rtsa ba'i thig dbyi'o//
analyzed: de nas hi hi zhes brjod nas sgo'i rtsa ba'i thig dbyi'o//
translated: Then, having uttered “hi hi,” one should drive in the thread at the base of the door.

original: thig thams cad btab nas ye shes kyi thig blos bteg la dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur bu ste /
analyzed: thig thams cad btab nas ye shes kyi thig blos bteg la dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur bu ste /
translated: Having driven in all the threads, one should raise the gnosis thread with the mind and drive in the peg of the dūrva grass at the center of the maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje gcig pa mgo rtse gcig pa h'um las bskyed par bsams la phur pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyud bzlas la brdung ba'i sngags kyis brdungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje gcig pa mgo rtse gcig pa h'um las bskyed par bsams la phur pa'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyud bzlas la brdung ba'i sngags kyis brdungs te /
translated: One should imagine that the single vajra, with its head facing up, is generated from hūṃ. Having recited the mantra of the peg one hundred and eight times, one should strike it with the mantra of striking.

original: zlum po'i thig btab nas aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: ye shes kyi thig skud gshegs su gsol te sangs rgyas kyi thugs kar gzhug go //
analyzed: zlum po'i thig btab nas aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: ye shes kyi thig skud gshegs su gsol te sangs rgyas kyi thugs kar gzhug go //
translated: Having driven in the circular thread, one should request the departure of the gnosis thread with oṃ āḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ and insert it into the heart of the Buddha.

original: thig skud kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: thig skud kyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure of the thread.

original: de nas rdul tshon la rigs lnga'i dam tshig bskyed la ye shes bstims nas aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes brgya rtsa brgyad bzla'o //
analyzed: de nas rdul tshon la rigs lnga'i dam tshig bskyed la ye shes bstims nas aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes brgya rtsa brgyad bzla'o //
translated: Then, having generated the pledge beings of the five families on the colored powder and caused the awareness beings to dissolve into them, recite Oṃ vajra-citra samaya hūṃ one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas yid kyis sbar ro //
analyzed: de nas yid kyis sbar ro //
translated: Then, mentally burn them.

original: dri dang me tog gis mchod la snod du gzhag go //
analyzed: dri dang me tog gis mchod la snod du gzhag go //
translated: Make offerings with incense and flowers and place them in a container.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor lte ba'i phur pa h'um bzhi pa'i sngags kyis bton la blos lag pa'i rdo rje la bstims te khung bu tshon sna lngas bkang la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor lte ba'i phur pa h'um bzhi pa'i sngags kyis bton la blos lag pa'i rdo rje la bstims te khung bu tshon sna lngas bkang la /
translated: Then, extract the dagger from the center of the mandala with the mantra of the four hūṃs, and mentally dissolve it into the vajra in the hand. Fill the hole with the five-colored powder.

original: 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
translated: This is the pure realm of phenomena,

original: sems can khams ni rab sgrol mdzad //
analyzed: sems can khams ni rab sgrol mdzad //
translated: the liberator of the realms of sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang rgyal te //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang rgyal te //
translated: I am the king Vajradhara,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: the place of all tathāgatas.

original: nyes pa kun las rnam par grol //
analyzed: nyes pa kun las rnam par grol //
translated: Totally liberated from all faults,

original: 'khor ba'i gnas su yang dag gnas //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i gnas su yang dag gnas //
translated: I abide in the place of saṃsāra.

original: zhes chos dbyings rnam par dag par mos nas aom badzra ram ga sa ma ya aom aa:h'um zhes brjod cing g-yas pas rdo rje bzung la @235a * //
analyzed: zhes chos dbyings rnam par dag par mos nas aom badzra ram ga sa ma ya aom aa:h'um zhes brjod cing g-yas pas rdo rje bzung la @235a * //
translated: Contemplating the purity of the realm of phenomena, recite Oṃ vajra-raṅga samaya oṃ aḥ hūṃ, and holding the vajra in the right hand,

original: g-yon pas dbang ldan nas g-yas skor du tshon dgye'o //
analyzed: g-yon pas dbang ldan nas g-yas skor du tshon dgye'o //
translated: One should draw the lines with the right hand, beginning from the northeast.

original: phyi nas slob ma dang ji ltar bde bas tshon dgye'o //
analyzed: phyi nas slob ma dang ji ltar bde bas tshon dgye'o //
translated: Later, the disciple should draw the lines as he likes.🔽Having anointed the outside of the maṇḍala with the five elixirs and scented water, incanted with hūṃ and āḥ, one should sprinkle the maṇḍala with water incanted with that mantra.

original: h'um dang 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang dri'i chus dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du byugs la de bzlas pa'i chus dkyil 'khor bsangs te rdul tshon lhag ma rnams aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: brjod pas ye shes pa gshegs su gsol te tshon sa gtsang sar
analyzed: h'um dang 'khyil pa bzlas pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang dri'i chus dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du byugs la de bzlas pa'i chus dkyil 'khor bsangs te rdul tshon lhag ma rnams aom a'a: h'um badzra mu: brjod pas ye shes pa gshegs su gsol te tshon sa gtsang sar
translated: Having invited the gnosis beings with the mantra oṃ āḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ, one should place the remaining colored powders in a clean place.

original: gzhag go // tshon dgye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag go // tshon dgye ba'o //
translated: This is the drawing of the lines.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs bzhir mdo bzhi bklag go //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs bzhir mdo bzhi bklag go //
translated: Then, one should recite the four summaries in the four directions of the maṇḍala.

original: spos phor brgyad gzhag go //
analyzed: spos phor brgyad gzhag go //
translated: One should place eight incense burners.

original: ras stong la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / 'phan la sogs pa yi ge h'um dang bdag po'i sngags bzlas pa'i aom badzra spa ra na kham zhes phul nas /
analyzed: ras stong la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / 'phan la sogs pa yi ge h'um dang bdag po'i sngags bzlas pa'i aom badzra spa ra na kham zhes phul nas /
translated: Having offered the thousand-piece canopy, victory banners, flags, streamers, and so on, incanted with the hūṃ and the master’s mantra, with oṃ vajra-sphāṇa khaṃ,

original: de nas 'khyil pa'i chus mandala bsangs te yi ge gsum dang 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas rdo rje dril bu bzung ste shar sgo nas nye bar nub tu phyogs pas gnas nas 'khor lo'i dbang po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bris pa'i dkyil 'khor stong pa nyid
analyzed: de nas 'khyil pa'i chus mandala bsangs te yi ge gsum dang 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas rdo rje dril bu bzung ste shar sgo nas nye bar nub tu phyogs pas gnas nas 'khor lo'i dbang po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bris pa'i dkyil 'khor stong pa nyid
translated: Then, having cleansed the maṇḍala with the water of the vase, having protected it with the three syllables and the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali, having taken up the vajra and the bell, facing west from the eastern door, endowed with the yoga of Cakrasaṃvara, one should imagine the empty maṇḍala as the nature of the maṇḍala to be generated, which is the nature of the protection wheel, the stabbing of the obstructors with the kīla, and so on.

original: kyi rjes la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bsgom par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du brtag par byas nas rab tu sgrub pa'i phyi rol gyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: kyi rjes la srung ba'i 'khor lo dang bgegs la phur bus gdab pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bsgom par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin du brtag par byas nas rab tu sgrub pa'i phyi rol gyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should enter into union with the external consort of practice.

original: de med na ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de med na ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par 'jug pas kyang rung ste /
translated: If that is not available, it is also suitable to enter into union with the gnosis consort.

original: yang dag par bskyod pa'i dga' ba'i sgras ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs la zhal bsil dang mchod yon phul ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi nang du bcug la 'dod chags chen pos zhu bar gyur pa de rdo rje'i lam nas byung nas padmar ye shes🔽kyi lha'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid spros te /
analyzed: yang dag par bskyod pa'i dga' ba'i sgras ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs la zhal bsil dang mchod yon phul ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi nang du bcug la 'dod chags chen pos zhu bar gyur pa de rdo rje'i lam nas byung nas padmar ye shes kyi lha'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid spros te /
translated: That arises from the path of the vajra and emanates as the nature of the wheel of pristine consciousness deities in the lotus.

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lo gnas ji lta bar zhugs par bsams nas spyan dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i de ma thag tu rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo rnams kyis dbang bskur nas
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lo gnas ji lta bar zhugs par bsams nas spyan dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i de ma thag tu rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo rnams kyis dbang bskur nas
translated: Having imagined that they enter into the commitment wheel in their respective places, immediately after the consecration of the eyes, body, and so on, the empowerment is conferred by the tathāgatas and goddesses summoned by the light rays of the seed syllable in one’s heart.

original: ji ltar rigs pas rgya sa gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pas rgya sa gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should be sealed by the appropriate one.

original: de nas mchod pa'i lha mo spros pa rnams kyis yid bzhin gyi mchod pas mchod de bsil ba'i ras dang ras zung dang / bla re la ras dpyangs pa dang yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pa'i bza' @235b ba dang bldag pa dang bca' ba dang gzhib pa dang btung ba dang zhal zas la sogs pa dang gser dang bu mo dang glang po che dang rta dang ba lang la sogs pa
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i lha mo spros pa rnams kyis yid bzhin gyi mchod pas mchod de bsil ba'i ras dang ras zung dang / bla re la ras dpyangs pa dang yi ge gsum gyis bsngags pa'i bza' @235b ba dang bldag pa dang bca' ba dang gzhib pa dang btung ba dang zhal zas la sogs pa dang gser dang bu mo dang glang po che dang rta dang ba lang la sogs pa
translated: Then, having emanated offering goddesses, make offerings with the offerings of the wish-fulfilling tree, cool sandalwood, pairs of garments, and silk canopies, and with food, drink, and so on, such as food, refreshments, solid food, beverages, and so forth, blessed by the three syllables, as well as gold, girls, elephants, horses, cows, and so forth.

original: phul nas phyi rol gyi rnal 'byor ma drug gam brgyad dam bzhis gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bos rang gi mchod pas mchod nas dril bu dkrol zhing /
analyzed: phul nas phyi rol gyi rnal 'byor ma drug gam brgyad dam bzhis gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bos rang gi mchod pas mchod nas dril bu dkrol zhing /
translated: Having made offerings with one’s own offerings in the aspect of Rūpavajrā and so on, with the six, eight, or four external yoginīs, ring the bell and recite:

original: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
translated: Akṣobhya, great timeless awareness,

original: rdo rje dbyings ni mkha' chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings ni mkha' chen po //
translated: vajra expanse, great space,

original: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog dkyil 'khor gsum //
translated: three sublime vajras, three mandalas—

original: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: homage and praise to the vajra expanse.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
translated: Vairocana, great purity,

original: rdo rje zhi ba dga' chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba dga' chen po //
translated: vajra peace, great joy,

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog /
translated: The nature of luminosity, supreme of the supreme,

original: ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise the teacher Vajradhara.

original: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
translated: The precious king is extremely profound,

original: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
translated: Vajra space is stainless,

original: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med //
translated: Unstained by the pure nature,

original: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise the vajra body.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal po che //
translated: Vajra amṛta, the great king,

original: mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Nonconceptual space, the vajra holder,

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa thob //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa thob //
translated: Attains the perfection of desire,

original: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise vajra speech.

original: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: don yod rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: Vajra Amoghasiddhi, the perfect buddha,

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa'i //
translated: The fulfiller of all wishes,

original: rang bzhin dag pas yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas yang dag 'byung //
translated: Pure by nature, truly arising,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise Vajrasattva.

original: ces bya bas bstod de /
analyzed: ces bya bas bstod de /
translated: Thus, one praises.

original: rang dang shes rab kyi me tog dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i snod du bcug nas bdud rtsir bcas pa phul te /
analyzed: rang dang shes rab kyi me tog dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i snod du bcug nas bdud rtsir bcas pa phul te /
translated: Placing one's own bodhicitta with the flower of wisdom in a lotus vessel with nectar, it is offered.

original: de rnams bdud rtsi myong bas tshim par byas la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du mos nas 'khor lo'i bdag po'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dkyil 'khor pa'i sngags nyi shu rtsa re re dang yi ge brgya pa bzla'o //
analyzed: de rnams bdud rtsi myong bas tshim par byas la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du mos nas 'khor lo'i bdag po'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad dkyil 'khor pa'i sngags nyi shu rtsa re re dang yi ge brgya pa bzla'o //
translated: Having satisfied them with the taste of nectar, one should imagine that they are of the nature of great bliss and recite the mantra of the lord of the wheel one hundred and eight times, and the mantras of the members of the maṇḍala twenty times each, and the one-hundred-syllable mantra.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dbul lo //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma dbul lo //
translated: One should offer a bali to all the spirits according to the rite that will be explained.

original: yong na sgrub pa'i grogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'gram du bzhag nas phyir byung ste 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i cho gas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang dbang po la sogs pa la gtor ma dbul lo //
analyzed: yong na sgrub pa'i grogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'gram du bzhag nas phyir byung ste 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i cho gas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang dbang po la sogs pa la gtor ma dbul lo //
translated: If one has a companion for the rite, one should place him next to the maṇḍala, go outside, and offer a bali to all the spirits according to the rite, and offer a bali to one’s chosen deity and to Indra, and so forth.

original: de nas lag pa g-yas pa gan rgyal du byas nas gung mo dang ming med cung zad bskum la mngon du phyogs par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lag pa g-yas pa gan rgyal du byas nas gung mo dang ming med cung zad bskum la mngon du phyogs par gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: lag pa gnyis pus mo nang du byas nas tsog tsog por 'dug cing /
translated: Having placed both hands on one’s knees, one should sit with one’s knees drawn up to one’s chest.

analyzed: mi smra bar lag pa'i ze'u 'bru'i kha la mang du bya ba cing lan gsum gsum du rna ba'i bug pa gnyis @236a * //

analyzed: dang / mig dang kha dang lag pa dang lto ba dang mgo rnams la reg par bya'o //

translated: Reciting the mantra “oṃ vajra āveśaya a āḥ,” and so on, one should enter the maṇḍala with the speed of a vajra, request the vajra, ring the bell, and recite oṃ hūṃ phaṭ with the vajra foot, oṃ hūṃ āḥ phaṭ, oṃ hūṃ a āḥ phaṭ, and oṃ hūṃ ha na ha na māraya duṣṭaṃ ghaṭaya ghaṭaya ā ā hūṃ hṛiḥ phaṭ.

original: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya aa aa h'um hri phat ces pa'i sngags bzhi go rims bzhin du zlos pa'i shar sgo la sogs par brjod do //
analyzed: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya aa aa h'um hri phat ces pa'i sngags bzhi go rims bzhin du zlos pa'i shar sgo la sogs par brjod do //
translated: Recite the four mantras in order, “oṃ hūṃ ha na ha na māraya duṣṭaṃ ghaṭaya ghaṭaya ā ā hūṃ hṛiḥ phaṭ,” and so on, at the eastern door, and so on.

original: slob ma rnams dang bskor ba gsum lhan cig tu byas nas lhag pa dang ma tshang pa'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor lo la bltas te phreng ba bcom ldan 'das la phul nas bskor ba'i grangs bzhin nub la sogs pa bzhir gnas pas shar la
analyzed: slob ma rnams dang bskor ba gsum lhan cig tu byas nas lhag pa dang ma tshang pa'i nyes pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor lo la bltas te phreng ba bcom ldan 'das la phul nas bskor ba'i grangs bzhin nub la sogs pa bzhir gnas pas shar la
translated: Having circumambulated three times together with the disciples, in order to pacify the faults of excess and omission, one should look at the wheel, offer the garland to the Bhagavān, and, according to the number of circumambulations, one should remain in the west, and so on, for four watches.

original: sogs pa bzhir aom badzrod bha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi sgo dbye bar sa sams te aom sa ma ya pra be sha ya m'i zhes brjod nas gar byed cing slar phreng ba blangs la rang rang gi mgo🔽la bcings te 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: sogs pa bzhir aom badzrod bha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi sgo dbye bar sa sams te aom sa ma ya pra be sha ya m'i zhes brjod nas gar byed cing slar phreng ba blangs la rang rang gi mgo la bcings te 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: Having opened the door with the mantra Oṃ vajra udghāṭaya samaya praveśaya hūṃ, one should say Oṃ samaya praveśaya māṃ, dance, take up the garland, and place it on one’s head.

original: nges sems can thams cad la dngos grub thams cad kyi bka' drin mdzod cing ces go bar byas nas bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: nges sems can thams cad la dngos grub thams cad kyi bka' drin mdzod cing ces go bar byas nas bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having bowed to the wheel, one should meditate and repeat the mantra, having made the request, “Please be kind to all sentient beings and grant all spiritual powers.”

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa las phyi ngos su dbang po la sogs pa go rims bzhin du dkar po dang / ser skya dang / nag po dang / dud ka dang / dmar po dang / khro bo dang / ser po dang / ljang gu'i ba dan brgyad dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la phul nas shar la sogs par gzugs par bya zhes pa ni shes rab skyong zer /
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa las phyi ngos su dbang po la sogs pa go rims bzhin du dkar po dang / ser skya dang / nag po dang / dud ka dang / dmar po dang / khro bo dang / ser po dang / ljang gu'i ba dan brgyad dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams la phul nas shar la sogs par gzugs par bya zhes pa ni shes rab skyong zer /
translated: Here, outside the maṇḍala house, one should offer eight banners—white, pale yellow, black, smoke-colored, red, wrathful, yellow, and green—to the maṇḍala deities in order, beginning with Indra, and place them in the east, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud du /
translated: The Bhagavān also says in the Buddhakapāla Tantra:

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: It has four sides and four doors,

original: ba dan brgyad kyis nye bar brgyan //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ba dan brgyad kyis nye bar brgyan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Adorned with eight banners.

original: de'i rigs rnam par snang mdzad dang @236b de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi ni rang rang phyogs su dgod par bya'o zhes kha cig ste /

original: rin chen dbang po dang de'i rigs can rnams ni bden bral du'o //🔽snang ba mtha' yas dang de'i rigs las byung ba rnams rlung du'o //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po dang de'i rigs can rnams ni bden bral du'o // snang ba mtha' yas dang de'i rigs las byung ba rnams rlung du'o //
translated: Ratnasambhava and those of his family are in the southwest.🔽Amitābha and those of his family are in the northwest.

original: don yod grub pa dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi lha rnams ni dbang ldan du'o//🔽'khor lo'i dbang po shar du'o //
analyzed: don yod grub pa dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi lha rnams ni dbang ldan du'o// 'khor lo'i dbang po shar du'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi and those of his family are in the northeast.

original: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams rang gi phyogs su zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi lha rnams rang gi phyogs su zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: Cakrasaṃvara is in the east, and the deities of his family are in their own directions.

original: dbang po ser po dang / khyab pa 'jug nag po dang / zla ba dkar po dang / nyi ma dmar po dang / tshangs pa ser po ste /
analyzed: dbang po ser po dang / khyab pa 'jug nag po dang / zla ba dkar po dang / nyi ma dmar po dang / tshangs pa ser po ste /
translated: Indra is yellow, Viṣṇu is black, Candra is white, Sūrya is red, and Brahmā is yellow.

original: dbang por me'i dbang po dang / gshin rje nag po dang / dben bral dud ka rnams ni rang rang gi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: dbang por me'i dbang po dang / gshin rje nag po dang / dben bral dud ka rnams ni rang rang gi phyogs su'o //
translated: In the east, Agni, black Yama, and smoky Vinayaka are in their own directions.

original: nub tu chu lha dkar po dang / sa ser mo dang / thags bzangs ris kyi nag po dang / rlung dang rlung gi ljang gu'o //
analyzed: nub tu chu lha dkar po dang / sa ser mo dang / thags bzangs ris kyi nag po dang / rlung dang rlung gi ljang gu'o //
translated: In the west, white Varuna, yellow Earth, black Vemacitrin, and green Vayu and Pavana.

original: byang du lus ngan po'i ser po dang / tshogs bdag gi dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang du lus ngan po'i ser po dang / tshogs bdag gi dkar po'o //
translated: In the north, yellow Kubera and white Ganapati.

original: dbang ldan du dbang po'i dkar po'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du dbang po'i dkar po'o //
translated: In the northeast, white Indra.

original: de ltar 'phan bco lnga ni phyogs kyi bdag po rnams mnyes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'phan bco lnga ni phyogs kyi bdag po rnams mnyes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Thus, the fifteen banners are for the sake of pleasing the lords of the directions.

original: mi 'byor na ni nus pa ji lta bar ba dan rnams dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i cho ga 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'byor na ni nus pa ji lta bar ba dan rnams dbul bar bya'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i cho ga 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: If one cannot afford it, one should offer as many flags as possible. This is the ritual of the mandala practice with its retinue.

original: de'i rjes la de nas bla mas nang par gtor ma btang nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa nas byung ste slob ma rnams la rmi lam dris nas ri las lhung pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rmi lam byung na bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas
analyzed: de'i rjes la de nas bla mas nang par gtor ma btang nas dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa nas byung ste slob ma rnams la rmi lam dris nas ri las lhung pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rmi lam byung na bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis bsrungs nas
translated: Then, the guru having offered the morning torma, having come out of the mandala house, having asked the disciples about their dreams, if they had non-virtuous dreams such as falling from a mountain, they should be protected with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi khang par 'jug pa'i tshe slob ma rnams kyi sngon du slob dpon zhugs par bya ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang par 'jug pa'i tshe slob ma rnams kyi sngon du slob dpon zhugs par bya ste //
translated: When entering the mandala house, the master should enter first,

original: aom bra be sha pha ga b'a na ma h'a su kha moksha pu ram sarba siddhi su kha pra da pa ra ma su kha au dha ma dhi siddhi dza: h'um bam ho: pra siddha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bra be sha pha ga b'a na ma h'a su kha moksha pu ram sarba siddhi su kha pra da pa ra ma su kha au dha ma dhi siddhi dza: h'um bam ho: pra siddha sv'a h'a /
translated: with the mantra: Oṃ, enter into the house of great bliss, the city of liberation, the abode of all accomplishments, the abode of the supreme attainment, the abode of the highest attainment, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, be accomplished svāhā.

original: zhes gzengs bstod pas zhugs nas g-yas skor gyis 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi nga rgyal gyis nub la sogs pa'i sgor gnas te dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i sgor aom badzra aud gha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes 'don zhing phye la
analyzed: zhes gzengs bstod pas zhugs nas g-yas skor gyis 'khor lo'i dbang phyug gi nga rgyal gyis nub la sogs pa'i sgor gnas te dkyil 'khor gyi shar la sogs pa'i sgor aom badzra aud gha ta ya sa ma ya pra be sha ya h'um zhes 'don zhing phye la
translated: One should open the door of the mandala, etc., with the mantra, Oṃ vajra udghāṭaya samaya praveśaya hūṃ.

original: / me tog gi phreng ba la aom pa ra ma su kham sh'a ya su la li te /
analyzed: / me tog gi phreng ba la aom pa ra ma su kham sh'a ya su la li te /
translated: One should cast the flower garland into the mandala with the mantra, Oṃ parama sukhaṃ śāyā sulilita

original: bi la s'i na mi ta na mi te na m'a mi bha ga b'a ntam dza: h'um bam ho: hi hi hi hi h'i: pra t'i tstsha ku su ma aanydza li ni n'a tha ho //
analyzed: bi la s'i na mi ta na mi te na m'a mi bha ga b'a ntam dza: h'um bam ho: hi hi hi hi h'i: pra t'i tstsha ku su ma aanydza li ni n'a tha ho //
translated: vilapasī nirmite nirmite namaḥ🔽 Translation: Having entered with that praise, one should stand at the western door, etc., with the pride of being the Lord of the Wheel, circumambulating to the right.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor la dor nas slar bzung ste phreng ba'i dbang gis bsam pas rang gi mgo la bcings nas mngon sum du @237a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor la dor nas slar bzung ste phreng ba'i dbang gis bsam pas rang gi mgo la bcings nas mngon sum du @237a * //
translated: One should open the door of the mandala, etc., with the mantra, Oṃ vajra udghāṭaya samaya praveśaya hūṃ.🔽One should cast the flower garland into the mandala with the mantra, Oṃ parama sukhaṃ śāyā sulilita🔽vilapasī nirmite nirmite namaḥ

original: gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i dbang phyug bla mar mos nas des ster bzhin pa'i phreng ba'i dbang la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i dbang ma lus pa dang tsho ga bzhin du slob dpon gyi las thams cad la gnang ba thob nas slob ma gzhug pa'i ched du bde
analyzed: gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i dbang phyug bla mar mos nas des ster bzhin pa'i phreng ba'i dbang la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i dbang ma lus pa dang tsho ga bzhin du slob dpon gyi las thams cad la gnang ba thob nas slob ma gzhug pa'i ched du bde
translated: Having imagined the guru as the lord of the wheel, one should request all the initiations that will be explained, such as the garland initiation, and so forth, and having obtained permission to perform all the activities of the master, one should, for the sake of inducting the disciples,

analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi bden pa'i byin rlabs kyang bya'o //

translated: Since it is endowed with the nature of being born from space,

analyzed: ; bden pa de yis mgon po bdag / khyed kyis 'dod pa rab rdzogs mdzod //

translated: Visualizing the disciple in the form of the Lord of the Wheel, one should tie the lower garment with the mantra, “Oṃ, all tathāgatas, please grant the consecration of the adornments of complete enlightenment.

analyzed: deng khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis rlob par 'gyur bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di khyod kyi dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la smra bar mi bya zhing dang pa dang mi ldan pa rnams

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags ldas rim pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag byed du bcug na /

analyzed: yang shas sgor aom gu ru car na p'u dza au pa sth'a na ya a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi /

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pa ri tra ma aam tha a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi /🔽zhes bya ba'i don sngon du 'gro bas 'don du gzhug go //

translated: Om, Sarva Tathagata Paritram Anatha Atmanam Niryatayami.

original: de nas deng khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su zhugs kyis deng ngas rdo rje'i ye shes bskyed pa'i ye shes gang 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dngos grub kyang thob na dngos grub gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos te /

translated: Then, today you have entered the family of all Tathagatas. Today I will generate the vajra wisdom in you. By this wisdom, if you attain the powers of all Tathagatas, what need is there to mention other powers?

original: khyod kyis dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba rnams kyi mdun du smra bar ma byed cig / dam tshig ma nyams par gyur ta re zhes mgo bro rdo rje bzung nas dril bu dkrol zhing /
analyzed: khyod kyis dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba rnams kyi mdun du smra bar ma byed cig / dam tshig ma nyams par gyur ta re zhes mgo bro rdo rje bzung nas dril bu dkrol zhing /

analyzed: 'di ni dam tshig rdo rje ste // gal te khyod kyis gang du yang //
translated: This is the vajra of sacred pledge.🔽If you speak of it

original: rung ba'i mdun du smra ma byed //
analyzed: rung ba'i mdun du smra ma byed //
translated: in front of anyone at all,

original: smras na spyi bo 'gas par 'gyur //
analyzed: smras na spyi bo 'gas par 'gyur //

original: zhes brjod nas snying gar rdo rje bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod nas snying gar rdo rje bzung ste /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' deng khyod kyi //

original: snying la yang dag zhugs par gyur //
analyzed: snying la yang dag zhugs par gyur //

original: gal te tshul 'di smras na ni //
analyzed: gal te tshul 'di smras na ni //

analyzed: de ma thag tu dral te gshegs //

translated: Having given this warning, take up the water of the victorious vase with the vessel held by the thumb and ring finger, pour it into the disciple’s mouth, and say:

original: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal ba'i chu //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal ba'i chu //
translated: This is your hell water.

original: 'das na sreg cing dmyal bar ltung //
analyzed: 'das na sreg cing dmyal bar ltung //
translated: If you transgress, you will burn and fall into hell.

original: dam tshig bsrungs na dngos grub ster /
analyzed: dam tshig bsrungs na dngos grub ster /
translated: If you keep the commitments, I will give you the powers.🔽Drink this water of vajra nectar.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu 'thungs shig / ces brjod cing khyor pas chu 'thung du bcug pa /
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu 'thungs shig / ces brjod cing khyor pas chu 'thung du bcug pa /
translated: Saying this, have them drink the water from the palm.

analyzed: der phyin chad khyod kyi phyag na rdo rje nga yin gyis ngas 'di byos shig ces bsgo ba gang yin pa de yang bya dgos so //
translated: From now on, I am your Vajrapāṇi. Whatever I command you to do, such as “Do this,” must be done.

original: khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig / brnyas pas khyod yang ba ma spangs bar khyod dus ma yin par shi pa'i dus byas nas dmyal bar gyur ta re zhes gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis nga la brnyas par ma byed cig / brnyas pas khyod yang ba ma spangs bar khyod dus ma yin par shi pa'i dus byas nas dmyal bar gyur ta re zhes gdon par bya'o //
translated: Do not treat me with contempt. If you do, you will not be able to avoid being light, and when the time comes for you to die, you will go to hell.

original: dam tshig gi chu sbyin pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi chu sbyin pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of giving the water of the commitments.

original: de nas bsgrub pa'i dus las sngon du @238b dngos grub la sogs pa nges pa'i don du slob ma snod dang ldan pa la lha dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgrub pa'i dus las sngon du @238b dngos grub la sogs pa nges pa'i don du slob ma snod dang ldan pa la lha dbab par bya'o //
translated: Then, before the time of the practice, the descent of the deity should be performed for the worthy disciple in order to ascertain the powers and so forth.

original: de la dang por ri la sogs pa yid dang rje sa su mthun pa'i gnas su sngon du 'gro ba byas pas sems brtan par rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor shin tu brtan par dmigs pa'o //

translated: First, in a place such as a mountain that is agreeable to the mind, one should perform the preliminaries, and then, with a stable mind, one should visualize the yoga of Vajrasattva.

original: 'bebs pa la nus pa thob pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lhag par gnas pa'i slob ma mdun du bya ste skad cig stong pa nyid kyi rjes la yi ge aa las byung pa'i snang ba mtha' yas gzugs su bskyed la /
analyzed: 'bebs pa la nus pa thob pas mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lhag par gnas pa'i slob ma mdun du bya ste skad cig stong pa nyid kyi rjes la yi ge aa las byung pa'i snang ba mtha' yas gzugs su bskyed la /
translated: Having obtained the ability to descend, one should place in front of oneself a disciple who is to be consecrated and who possesses the characteristics, and after an instant of emptiness, one should generate him as the form of Amitābha arisen from the letter oṃ.🔽One should cause him to recite, “May all tathāgatas bless me, and may Vajrasattva descend.”

original: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis rlobs la rdo rje sems dpa' 'bab par gyur cig ces 'don du bcug nas de'i snying gar lam las bskyed pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po rdo rje sa mtshan pa gru bzhi par nyi ma la h'um sngo po
analyzed: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis rlobs la rdo rje sems dpa' 'bab par gyur cig ces 'don du bcug nas de'i snying gar lam las bskyed pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po rdo rje sa mtshan pa gru bzhi par nyi ma la h'um sngo po
translated: Then, at his heart, one should generate a yellow earth maṇḍala arisen from laṃ, square, marked with vajras, and upon a sun, a blue hūṃ.

original: dang mgo bo la bam las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar zhing zlum pa bu ma pas mtshan par zla ba la yi ge aom dkar po dang mgrin par yam las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu lta bu ba dan g-yo ba gnyis kyis mtshan
analyzed: dang mgo bo la bam las byung ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar zhing zlum pa bu ma pas mtshan par zla ba la yi ge aom dkar po dang mgrin par yam las byung ba'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po gzhu lta bu ba dan g-yo ba gnyis kyis mtshan
translated: On the throat, a blue bow-shaped air maṇḍala arisen from yaṃ, marked with two fluttering banners, and on the moon, a red āḥ.

original: par zla ba la yi ge aa dmar po bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rje rnams kyi rang bzhin h'um a'a: aom gyi yi ge rnams la bcug nas rkang pa gnyis kyi 'og nas rlung gi dkyil
analyzed: par zla ba la yi ge aa dmar po bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rje rnams kyi rang bzhin h'um a'a: aom gyi yi ge rnams la bcug nas rkang pa gnyis kyi 'og nas rlung gi dkyil
translated: After meditating on those, the light rays from the seed syllable in one’s heart draw in the nature of Vajra Body, Speech, and Mind, the syllables hūṃ, āḥ, and oṃ, and the two feet are marked with a wind maṇḍala.🔽From the transformation of raṃ, there is a red, triangular fire maṇḍala marked with a red raṃ, which emits light rays.

original: 'khor gyis mtshan pa'i ram yongs su gyur pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa yi ge ram dmar pos mtshan pa cig 'od zer 'phros pa las gnas pa'i ye ge dzhe dmar pos slob ma 'degs shing yi ge dzhee gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis 'og
analyzed: 'khor gyis mtshan pa'i ram yongs su gyur pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa yi ge ram dmar pos mtshan pa cig 'od zer 'phros pa las gnas pa'i ye ge dzhe dmar pos slob ma 'degs shing yi ge dzhee gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis 'og
translated: The resident red syllable jhe lifts the disciple, and a mass of light rays from the syllable jhe draws in the fire maṇḍala.

original: gi bu ga nas zhugs pa dang h'um la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis lus ma lus pa kun nas bkang par bsgom zhing spos phor 'degs pa sngon du 'gro bas dril bu dkrol zhing a'a be sha ya stam bha ya ra ra ra ra tsa la ya
analyzed: gi bu ga nas zhugs pa dang h'um la sogs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis lus ma lus pa kun nas bkang par bsgom zhing spos phor 'degs pa sngon du 'gro bas dril bu dkrol zhing a'a be sha ya stam bha ya ra ra ra ra tsa la ya
translated: One should meditate that the body is completely filled with light rays from the hūṃ and so forth that enter through the cranial aperture.🔽Having first raised the incense burner, one should ring the bell and recite the mantra āveśaya aṭṭaḥ sthaṃ ra ra ra ra cala ya cala ya hūṃ haṃ jheṃ one hundred times.

original: tsa la ya h'um ha aa dzheem zhes bya ba'i sngags lan brgyar 'don zhing bsam gtan mchog tu gzhol pas dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: tsa la ya h'um ha aa dzheem zhes bya ba'i sngags lan brgyar 'don zhing bsam gtan mchog tu gzhol pas dbab par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the descent of the awareness by being absorbed in supreme concentration.🔽If the descent is too strong, one should visualize Meru, which is made of vajra, above the head, above that the maṇḍala of the great lord, above that a five-pronged vajra, above that the syllable jḥiṃ, and above that Vairocana.

original: gal te phebs nas cher 'phags par gyur na de'i steng du ri rab rdo rje'i rang bzhin de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa de'i steng du yi ge dza: de'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms te bzlog par
analyzed: gal te phebs nas cher 'phags par gyur na de'i steng du ri rab rdo rje'i rang bzhin de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor de'i steng du rdo rje rtse lnga pa de'i steng du yi ge dza: de'i steng du rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms te bzlog par
translated: In that way, one should reverse the descent.

original: bya'o // de ltar phebs par gyur pa las slob ma'i thugs rdo rje'i @239a * //
analyzed: bya'o // de ltar phebs par gyur pa las slob ma'i thugs rdo rje'i @239a * //
translated: In that way, the descent of the awareness being into the disciple’s heart vajra causes the disciple to faint.

original: 'od zer rnams kyis gsung rdo rje'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid bskul bar byas la lces la zla ba la gnas pa'i a'a: dmar po las 'od zer gyi phreng bas 'khrugs pa bsgoms nas rdo rje smros zhing ces smrar gzhug pa byas la de ltar 'dis rang ngam
analyzed: 'od zer rnams kyis gsung rdo rje'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid bskul bar byas la lces la zla ba la gnas pa'i a'a: dmar po las 'od zer gyi phreng bas 'khrugs pa bsgoms nas rdo rje smros zhing ces smrar gzhug pa byas la de ltar 'dis rang ngam
translated: Having caused the light rays to arouse the nature of the seed of Vajra Speech, one should meditate on the red A on the moon at the tongue, agitated by a garland of light rays, and cause the vajra speech to speak.

original: gzhan gyi dge ba'am mi dge ba'i bya ba bden par smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dge ba'am mi dge ba'i bya ba bden par smra'o //
translated: Thus, this one speaks the truth of one's own or another's virtuous or nonvirtuous deeds.

original: de nas zhugs pa'i lha'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bkug nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon la bstim zhing slob ma'i mgo la rdo rje bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas zhugs pa'i lha'i snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bkug nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon la bstim zhing slob ma'i mgo la rdo rje bzung nas /
translated: Then, having summoned with light rays from the heart of the invoked deity, one dissolves into one's own heart seed syllable, and holding the vajra on the disciple's head,🔽one should request with:

original: aom khyed kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
analyzed: aom khyed kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
translated: OṂ You have performed all benefits for sentient beings,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
translated: Please grant the corresponding spiritual powers,

original: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
translated: And having gone to the land of the Buddha,

original: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //

translated: Anoint the heart with saffron, place a flower garland on the head, offer water for welcoming in front, surround with lamps, and fumigate with incense mixed with ghee, while reciting the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali or the letter hūṃ seven times. This is the ritual of the sequence of activities.🔽After that, with a handful of water from the Amṛtakuṇḍali praise, sprinkle the five nectars and the five elixirs in the copper vessel, and also sprinkle with pure water.

original: zhes brjod pas bskul la yang chu gtsang mas bkru zhing /

original: rdo rje can gyis sangs rgyas la //

analyzed: de ltar 'di la stsal du gsol //

translated: Then the tathāgatas enter into union with their consorts and melt into the state of lust. They enter through the crown topknot of Vairocana and emerge from the vajra path into the space of the goddess Locanā.

translated: Having entered through the lotus, in an instant, after emptiness, the awareness being Akṣobhya, arisen from the hūṃ and vajra, inseparable from the wisdom being, is empowered.🔽Then, having arisen from the lotus of the body of the form of Akṣobhya, with the face and so on, from the sky, the awareness being Locanā, and so on, together with the awareness consorts, with parasols, victory banners, flags, music, song, dance, flowers, saffron, and so on, and with the branches of the tree in hand, the white jasmine flowers filled with the elixir of bodhicitta, empower the disciples.

original: khams gsum kun gyis phyag byas pa //

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi //

analyzed: de la me tog la sogs pa dbul lo //

original: de'i rjes su /
analyzed: de'i rjes su /

original: mgon bo yis ni bdag la gsung //
analyzed: mgon bo yis ni bdag la gsung //

analyzed: sems can kun gyi don bgyid phyir //

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes dang 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo dam tshig dang / bya ba dang mi bya ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sngom pa dang / de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba la skal ba dang ldan pa nyid du brjod do //

translated: Thus, the gnosis of the reality of the maṇḍala and so on, the essence of the vow that is not to be transgressed, the restraint that has the nature of what is to be done and not to be done, and likewise, the suitability for accomplishment are expressed.

analyzed: bdag la nye bar mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: 'phang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de med na gzhan yang rung ste bla ma la phul nas bla ma rdo rje sems dpar mos la thal mo sbyar nas /

analyzed: khyod kyi zhabs kyi bka' drin gyis //

original: bdag gis bla med bya ba thob //
analyzed: bdag gis bla med bya ba thob //

analyzed: de phyir gsang pa'i dbang dag gis //

translated: Then, the guru, possessing the pride of Cakrasaṃvara, having generated the form of an ordinary woman into emptiness and then as the form of a goddess, and having performed the rite of union with the vajra and lotus,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /

original: zhes 'don zhing snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan ma la sogs pa dang snyoms par zhugs pas bkug la bdag nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas bcug la 'dod chags chen

translated: They enter through Vairocana’s mouth and melt through great passion into the avadhūti.

original: pos zhu bar gyur te aa wa rh'u t'i nas 'gro bar bsams nas rdo rje nor bur lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba brtan par byas te /
analyzed: pos zhu bar gyur te aa wa rh'u t'i nas 'gro bar bsams nas rdo rje nor bur lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba brtan par byas te /

original: mthe bong dang ming med kyi rdo rje nor bu btsir nas padma las byung nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhu ba'i khu bde rang gi byang chub kyi sems dang dbyer med par mos nas /
analyzed: mthe bong dang ming med kyi rdo rje nor bu btsir nas padma las byung nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhu ba'i khu bde rang gi byang chub kyi sems dang dbyer med par mos nas /
translated: The thumb and the ring finger squeeze the vajra jewel, and the bodhicitta that arises from the lotus is imagined to be inseparable from the melted tathāgatas.

original: gsung rdo rje'i gzugs can gyi slob mas mthong nas ma dad kyis dogs pa med pa'i khar ram /
analyzed: gsung rdo rje'i gzugs can gyi slob mas mthong nas ma dad kyis dogs pa med pa'i khar ram /

analyzed: ji srid du gdong g-yogs bcings pa nyid kyis de mthong ba'i spyod yul ma yin par ro //

original: rdo rje 'chang sogs 'das pa yis //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang sogs 'das pa yis //

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas sras dbang bskur //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas sras dbang bskur //

original: de ltar byang chub sems bzang pos //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems bzang pos //

analyzed: bu khyod dbang ni bskur bar bgyi //

original: zhes bya ba dang / 'khor lo'i bdag po'i sngags dang / aom badzra dhri ka h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du gdon zhing dbab par bya'o //

analyzed: des kyang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshags pa kun 'dus pa'i blos aa ho ma h'a su kha zhes brjod cing btung bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas gleng po che dang / rta dang / rin po che dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul dang / gser dang / rgyan dang / ba lang dang / ma he dang / bran po dang / bran mo dang / khol po la sogs pa dang /
translated: Then, the disciple should offer to the master whatever he can afford: elephants, horses, precious things, gold, silver, ornaments, cows, buffaloes, male and female servants, slaves, etc.

original: gces pa'i chung ma dang / bu dang bu mo la sogs pa rnams sam ji ltar nus pas bla ma la bsnyen bskur gyi phyir dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gces pa'i chung ma dang / bu dang bu mo la sogs pa rnams sam ji ltar nus pas bla ma la bsnyen bskur gyi phyir dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer one’s cherished wife, son, daughter, and so forth, or whatever one can afford, to the guru in order to serve him.

original: gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang dge 'dun la ston mo la sogs pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang dge 'dun la ston mo la sogs pa yang bya'o //
translated: One should also perform bali offerings, fire-offering rituals, gaṇacakra feasts, and feasts for the saṅgha.

original: de nas cho ga ji lta bar rgyas pa dang zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas nas rang nyid kyis dkyil 'khor mchod pas mchod de //
analyzed: de nas cho ga ji lta bar rgyas pa dang zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas nas rang nyid kyis dkyil 'khor mchod pas mchod de //
translated: Then, having performed the fire-offering rituals of increase and pacification according to the rite, one should offer a mandala to oneself.

original: thams cad kyis ci nus pa ji lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams la mchod pa gyis shig ces pas slob ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byed du bcug nas zhugs ba rnams la yang bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang /
analyzed: thams cad kyis ci nus pa ji lta ba de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams la mchod pa gyis shig ces pas slob ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byed du bcug nas zhugs ba rnams la yang bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang /
translated: Having caused the disciples and so on to make offerings to the tathāgatas and so forth, as much as they can, one should satisfy the guests with the gaṇacakra ritual of food, drink,

original: bldag pa dang / chang la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i tshul rnams kyis tshim par bya ste /
analyzed: bldag pa dang / chang la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i tshul rnams kyis tshim par bya ste /
translated: and so on, with the food, drink, and so forth that are to be licked, sucked, and chewed, and with beer and so on.

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu mi nyal bar dkar po la sogs pa dang byang chub kyi sems sgrub pas yang dag par mchod nas khyod rnams kyis 'jug pa 'di su la yang brjod par mi bya'o /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu mi nyal bar dkar po la sogs pa dang byang chub kyi sems sgrub pas yang dag par mchod nas khyod rnams kyis 'jug pa 'di su la yang brjod par mi bya'o /
translated: Do not sleep with them.🔽Having made offerings to them with white and so forth and the accomplishment of the thought of awakening, you should not speak of this engagement to anyone.

original: zhes bka' bsgos nas slob dpon gyis yon blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bka' bsgos nas slob dpon gyis yon blang bar bya'o //
translated: Having made a perfect offering to them by not sleeping with them, and by accomplishing the white [purity], etc., and the Thought of Enlightenment, the master should request the fee from them, after having ordered them, “You should not tell this procedure to anyone.”

original: des kyang gus pas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang gus pas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: They should offer it respectfully.

original: rin chen yid 'ong chung ma dang // rang gi lus dang zhing dang ni //
analyzed: rin chen yid 'ong chung ma dang // rang gi lus dang zhing dang ni //
translated: One’s wife who is a precious and attractive jewel, one’s own body, and one’s field,

original: ji ltar bla ma mnyes 'gyur dbul //
analyzed: ji ltar bla ma mnyes 'gyur dbul //
translated: are offered to the guru in whatever way pleases him.

original: mdor bsdus nas ni 'di ltar bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas ni 'di ltar bya //
translated: In brief, it is like this.

original: bla ma mnyes na dngos grub 'grub //🔽gzhan @249a * //
analyzed: bla ma mnyes na dngos grub 'grub // gzhan @249a * //
translated: If the guru is pleased, there is the attainment of power.

original: du min zhes thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: du min zhes thub pas gsungs //
translated: It is not otherwise, the Sage has said.

original: slob dpon bla med byed pa po //
analyzed: slob dpon bla med byed pa po //
translated: The unsurpassed master is

original: rdo rje sems dpa' mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' mchod pa'o //
translated: the worshipper of Vajrasattva.🔽What is his merit?

original: de yi bsod nams ma byas ci //🔽dka' thub ma spyad par yang dag / ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de yi bsod nams ma byas ci // dka' thub ma spyad par yang dag / ces gsungs pas so //
translated: What austerity has he not practiced?

original: der slob ma bkod nas phyi rol tu phyogs skyong gi gtor ma gtang //
analyzed: der slob ma bkod nas phyi rol tu phyogs skyong gi gtor ma gtang //
translated: Having arranged the disciples there, one should offer the sacrificial cake of the direction protectors outside.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas dang du zhugs nas dkyil 'khor la phyag 'tshal te 'khor lo'i bdag por mchod yon la sogs pa phul nas dge ba yongs la bsngo ste dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas shar🔽sgor 'dug ste /
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas dang du zhugs nas dkyil 'khor la phyag 'tshal te 'khor lo'i bdag por mchod yon la sogs pa phul nas dge ba yongs la bsngo ste dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas shar sgor 'dug ste /
translated: Having made offerings and so forth, having entered, having paid homage to the maṇḍala, having offered water for the feet and so forth to the Lord of the maṇḍala, having dedicated the virtue to all, having circumambulated the maṇḍala three times, having paid homage to the Bhagavān, one should sit in the eastern door.

original: yi ge brgya pa lan gsum brjod do //🔽gang yang bdag blo gti mug pas //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa lan gsum brjod do // gang yang bdag blo gti mug pas //
translated: One should recite the one-hundred-syllable mantra three times.🔽Whatever misdeeds I have done🔽in this good practice,

original: legs spyad 'di la nyes gyur gang //🔽gang phyir lus can skyabs gyur pa //
analyzed: legs spyad 'di la nyes gyur gang // gang phyir lus can skyabs gyur pa //
translated: whatever I have done out of ignorance,

original: de kun mgon khyod bzod par gsol //🔽gtso bo nas pa ma mchis shing //
analyzed: de kun mgon khyod bzod par gsol // gtso bo nas pa ma mchis shing //
translated: I request forbearance from you, O Protector.

original: ma rnyed pa dang ma tshang pa //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang ma tshang pa //
translated: Whatever I have done out of ignorance🔽in this good practice,

original: 'dir ni bya ba gang bgyis pa //
analyzed: 'dir ni bya ba gang bgyis pa //
translated: whatever I have done out of ignorance,

original: de kun mgon khyod bzod pa'i gsol //
analyzed: de kun mgon khyod bzod pa'i gsol //
translated: I request forbearance from you, O Protector.

original: zhes bzod par gsol nas /
analyzed: zhes bzod par gsol nas /
translated: Having requested forbearance,🔽one should recite:

original: aom khyed kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
analyzed: aom khyed kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
translated: Oṃ, you who have accomplished all the purposes of sentient beings,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
translated: bestow the appropriate spiritual powers,

original: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
translated: having gone to the land of the buddhas,

original: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: slar yang 'byon par mdzad du gsol //
translated: Please come again.

original: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu:/
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um badzra mu:/
translated: Om aḥ hūṃ vajra muḥ.🔽Having requested the departure of the wisdom mandala with this, one should dissolve the emanated mandala into oneself.

original: zhes pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol nas rang nyid kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rang nyid la bcug la aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'a dya nu tpanna tv'a ta aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a aom a'a: h'um mu:/
analyzed: zhes pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gshegs su gsol nas rang nyid kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rang nyid la bcug la aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'a dya nu tpanna tv'a ta aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a aom a'a: h'um mu:/
translated: Om āḥ hūṃ muḥ.

original: zhes 'don cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos nas dril bu dkrol zhing lag pa na gnas pa'i rdo rjes shar sgro nas brtsams te tshangs thig gi lam nas gtso bo'i gnas kyi bar du dbyi zhing //
analyzed: zhes 'don cing chos thams cad skye ba med par mos nas dril bu dkrol zhing lag pa na gnas pa'i rdo rjes shar sgro nas brtsams te tshangs thig gi lam nas gtso bo'i gnas kyi bar du dbyi zhing //
translated: Reciting this, one should imagine that all phenomena are unborn, ring the bell, and with the vajra in one’s hand, beginning from the eastern petal, one should wipe [the maṇḍala] along the path of the Brahmā line up to the place of the principal deity.

original: rang gi mgo la rdul tshon cung zad tsam blugs nas padma la sogs pa'i bar du byi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mgo la rdul tshon cung zad tsam blugs nas padma la sogs pa'i bar du byi bar bya'o //
translated: Having poured a little bit of colored powder on one’s head, one should wipe [the maṇḍala] up to the lotus, and so on.

original: de nas sgo rnams la gnas pa dang zur ni lag pa na gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rtse mos gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgo rnams la gnas pa dang zur ni lag pa na gnas pa'i rdo rje'i rtse mos gzhig par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should destroy the [colored powder] that remains in the doorways and corners with the tip of the vajra in one’s hand.

original: aom badzra k'i l'a ya auta k'i l'a ya sarba k'i lam badzra dha r'a y'a dzny'a ba ya ti h'um h'um h'um h'um phat ho zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i l'a ya auta k'i l'a ya sarba k'i lam badzra dha r'a y'a dzny'a ba ya ti h'um h'um h'um h'um phat ho zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One should recite the mantra, Om, to Vajra Kali, to Utkali, to all Kali, to the vajra-holder, knowledge is produced. Hum hum hum hum phat ho.

original: h'um gi sngags kyis phur ba rnams bton nas /🔽aom ru ru spu ru dzva la tishtha siddha lo ca ni sarba aa tva s'a dha ne sv'a h'a /
analyzed: h'um gi sngags kyis phur ba rnams bton nas / aom ru ru spu ru dzva la tishtha siddha lo ca ni sarba aa tva s'a dha ne sv'a h'a /
translated: Or, one should extract the daggers with the mantra of Hum.

original: zhes bya ba'i chu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas bkru'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i chu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pas bkru'o //
translated: One should wash with water over which the mantra, Om, ruru spuru, blaze, be firm, accomplish all things, fulfill all wishes, svaha, has been recited one hundred and eight times.

original: phur ba'i lha rnams @249b gshegs su gsol lo /
analyzed: phur ba'i lha rnams @249b gshegs su gsol lo /
translated: One should request the deities of the daggers to depart.

original: khung bu yang dgang ngo //
analyzed: khung bu yang dgang ngo //
translated: One should fill in the holes.

original: nang zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du gnyer ba la rdul tshon cung zad byin nas rgyal ba'i bum pa'am /🔽bum pa gcad ma gzhan ras kyis brgyan pa'i rnal 'byor mas bzung ste /
analyzed: nang zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du gnyer ba la rdul tshon cung zad byin nas rgyal ba'i bum pa'am / bum pa gcad ma gzhan ras kyis brgyan pa'i rnal 'byor mas bzung ste /
translated: For the sake of those who seek the inner peace, etc., one should give a little of the colored powders.🔽A yoginī should hold the victorious vase or another vase that is wrapped in cloth.

original: khyogs la zhon pa'i slob dpon nam /
analyzed: khyogs la zhon pa'i slob dpon nam /
translated: The master should ride in a palanquin.

original: slob mas dril bu'i sgra dang rol mo'i sgra dang gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mchod pa rnams dang ldan pas 'bab chu chen po'am chu zab mor khyer nas 'gram du 'dug ste ba'i lci bas byugs la dri dkar pos byugs /
analyzed: slob mas dril bu'i sgra dang rol mo'i sgra dang gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mchod pa rnams dang ldan pas 'bab chu chen po'am chu zab mor khyer nas 'gram du 'dug ste ba'i lci bas byugs la dri dkar pos byugs /
translated: The disciple, with the sound of the bell, the sound of music, parasols, victory banners, flags, and offerings, should carry [the maṇḍala] to a great river or deep water, sit on the bank, anoint [the maṇḍala] with cow dung, and anoint it with white scent.

original: dkyil 'khor byas nas padma'i lte ba la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'dab ma la klu rnams sngon bzhin du mchod do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byas nas padma'i lte ba la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'dab ma la klu rnams sngon bzhin du mchod do //
translated: Having made the maṇḍala, one should make offerings to Vajrasattva in the center of the lotus and to the nāgas on the petals, as before.

original: klu gtor gyi sngags kyis 'o thug gi gtor ma byin nas mchod do //
analyzed: klu gtor gyi sngags kyis 'o thug gi gtor ma byin nas mchod do //
translated: Having given the bali offering of milk porridge with the mantra of the nāga bali offering, one should make offerings.

original: klu rnams la rdul tshon gtan nas chu la blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: klu rnams la rdul tshon gtan nas chu la blugs par bya'o //
translated: One should never pour the colored powders of the nāgas into the water.

original: klu rnams kyis kyang bkur sti chen pos sa 'og tu khyer bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: klu rnams kyis kyang bkur sti chen pos sa 'og tu khyer bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the nāgas carry [the maṇḍala] to the underworld with great respect.

original: yang rdul tshon khyer ba'i bum ba de chus bkang nas de kho na bzhin bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang rdul tshon khyer ba'i bum ba de chus bkang nas de kho na bzhin bzhag ste /
translated: Again, having filled the vase that carried the colored powders with water, one should place it there just as it was.

original: de nas zhi ba'i don du dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i khang pa chag chag gdab bo //
analyzed: de nas zhi ba'i don du dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i khang pa chag chag gdab bo //
translated: Then, for the sake of pacifying, one should sprinkle the maṇḍala house, and so on.

original: ba'i lci bas byugs pa'i dkyil 'khor par gzhon nu ma rnams la 'o thug gi ston mos tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i lci bas byugs pa'i dkyil 'khor par gzhon nu ma rnams la 'o thug gi ston mos tshim par bya'o //
translated: The master should then say to the young women, You should satisfy yourselves with the feast of milk-rice.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis /
translated: Then the master

original: mkho ba'i yo byad rnams bsdus nas //
analyzed: mkho ba'i yo byad rnams bsdus nas //
translated: should gather up the necessary articles

original: rang nyid kyis ni spyad par bya //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni spyad par bya //
translated: and use them himself.

original: slob ma la sogs cung zad yin //🔽khung bu 'geng dang rab gnas dang // sbyin sreg dkyil 'khor nor gang yin //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs cung zad yin // khung bu 'geng dang rab gnas dang // sbyin sreg dkyil 'khor nor gang yin //
translated: Whatever is left over is for the disciples and so forth.🔽The master alone is entitled to the profits from filling in holes, consecration,

original: de kun slob dpon nyid dbang zhes //
analyzed: de kun slob dpon nyid dbang zhes //
translated: fire sacrifice, and the mandala.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa mchog gis gsungs //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa mchog gis gsungs //
translated: This is what the supreme Vajra Holder has said.

original: yon bdag gis rab gnas byas pa'i sku gzugs la sogs pa bskyod par rung ba ni rol mo'i sgra la sogs pas mchod pas rang rang gi gnas su khyer nas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yon bdag gis rab gnas byas pa'i sku gzugs la sogs pa bskyod par rung ba ni rol mo'i sgra la sogs pas mchod pas rang rang gi gnas su khyer nas mchod par bya'o //
translated: The patron should carry away the image, etc., which is fit to be moved, after it has been consecrated, to its own place, and worship it with music, etc.

original: slob dpon dang sgo'i dpon rnams ngang las kyi rdo rje can dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dang bzo rnams ji ltar rigs par nos pa ji lta bar ras la sogs pa dang so rtsi la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang sgo'i dpon rnams ngang las kyi rdo rje can dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dang bzo rnams ji ltar rigs par nos pa ji lta bar ras la sogs pa dang so rtsi la sogs pas tshim par bya'o //
translated: The master, the door-keeper, the karma-vajra-holder, the yoginis, and the artisans should be satisfied with cloth, etc. and with tooth-sticks, etc. as they deserve.

original: dge 'dun la ston mo dang rnal 'byor ba la tshogs kyi 'khor lo yang bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la ston mo dang rnal 'byor ba la tshogs kyi 'khor lo yang bya'o //
translated: A feast for the Sangha and a ganacakra for the yogins should also be performed.

original: dman pa dang mgon med pa rnams la'ang tshim par bya'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu pa'i cho ga'o //🔽de ltar @250a * //
analyzed: dman pa dang mgon med pa rnams la'ang tshim par bya'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdu pa'i cho ga'o // de ltar @250a * //
translated: The poor and the helpless should also be satisfied. This is the ritual for the dissolution of the mandala.

original: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Here is the ritual for drawing the mandala.

original: bri ba'i cho ga 'di yid kyis bsgrubs pa'i cho ga nyid kyis kyang 'bras bu dang ldan no zhes bya bas yid kyi cho ga kho na mchog yin no //
analyzed: bri ba'i cho ga 'di yid kyis bsgrubs pa'i cho ga nyid kyis kyang 'bras bu dang ldan no zhes bya bas yid kyi cho ga kho na mchog yin no //
translated: This ritual of drawing [the mandala] is also fruitful by the ritual of mental practice alone. Thus, the mental ritual is supreme.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i gzugs kyis sa gzung ba la sogs pa dang / sku gzugs la sogs pa'i rab gnas dang / slob ma la dbang bskur ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi mthar thug pa thams cad yid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i gzugs kyis sa gzung ba la sogs pa dang / sku gzugs la sogs pa'i rab gnas dang / slob ma la dbang bskur ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi mthar thug pa thams cad yid kyis bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the taking of the ground, etc., by the form of the Lord of the Mandala, the consecration of the image, etc., the initiation of the disciple, the request for departure, and the conclusion of the peace-fire offering, all are to be done mentally.

original: de nyid kyi tshe gang gis kha cig tu sbrel ba dang 'di dag thams cad byar mi nus pa'am mi rnyed pa de'i tshe bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe gang gis kha cig tu sbrel ba dang 'di dag thams cad byar mi nus pa'am mi rnyed pa de'i tshe bsgom par bya'o //
translated: At that time, when one is not able to do all these things, or when one is not able to find the materials, then one should meditate.

original: de'i tshe dngos po yod pa la yang bsam gtan kho na gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po yod pa la yang bsam gtan kho na gtso bo yin no //
translated: At that time, even if there are things, only the meditation is principal.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa lta ba dang sbyin pa la mngon par dag pa la sogs pas bsod nams spel ba 'ga' zhig gi che du phyi mchod kyi cho ga 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa lta ba dang sbyin pa la mngon par dag pa la sogs pas bsod nams spel ba 'ga' zhig gi che du phyi mchod kyi cho ga 'dod do //
translated: However, some people desire the rite of the external offering, which increases merit by means of the purification of the view and the giving, etc.

original: rgyu med cing tshogs pa dang bral bas ni bsgom pa kho nas cho ga thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med cing tshogs pa dang bral bas ni bsgom pa kho nas cho ga thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: Since it is without cause and free from assembly, all rites should be accomplished by meditation alone.

original: de'i phyir las dang po pas kyang sems brtan pas yid kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor du sngon gyi rab gnas dang / skal ba la bstan pa dang dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang po pas kyang sems brtan pas yid kyis sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor du sngon gyi rab gnas dang / skal ba la bstan pa dang dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, even a beginner should stabilize the mind and perform the consecration of the mandala emanated by the mind, the teaching of the good fortune, and the empowerment.

original: de ltar yang sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de ltar yang sangs rgyas thod pa'i rgyud las /
translated: Thus, in the Buddhakapāla-tantra,

original: shes rab padma'i nang dbus su //
analyzed: shes rab padma'i nang dbus su //
translated: in the center of the lotus of wisdom,

original: dpag tshad byi ba'i dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: dpag tshad byi ba'i dkyil 'khor la //
translated: in the mandala of the earth,

original: dkyil 'khor de yi dbus su ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de yi dbus su ni //
translated: in the center of that mandala,

original: mkhas pas slob ma dbang bskur bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas slob ma dbang bskur bya //
translated: the wise one should confer empowerment on the disciple.

original: zhes pa dang gzhan du yang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dang gzhan du yang gsungs pa ste /
translated: And it is also said elsewhere:

original: yid kyis 'ga' zhig nyid du ni //
analyzed: yid kyis 'ga' zhig nyid du ni //
translated: In some place in the mind,

original: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bya bar bzhed //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor bya bar bzhed //
translated: the mandala of the Victor is to be made.

original: ces gsungs so zhes pa ni yid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs so zhes pa ni yid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'o //
